His long hair flies around his head and the skirts of his gown sweep leftward as if in a wind. Light beams from his body and brightens the sky around him.

Cato stands in the lower left corner of the design, partially hiding the entrance to the cave. He faces right. His right arm is bent across his chest. His arms may be folded and his left hand may be visible on his right elbow. He has long hair and a long beard, and wears a gown.

A group of spirits destined for Purgatory stand on the shore below the mountain, having just arrived in the boat that is now some distance from shore. At the far left of the group, an indistinctly drawn figure stands looking forward. This figure is just visible between the mountain and another figure to the right.

A group of spirits destined for Purgatory stand on the shore below the mountain, having just arrived in the boat that is now some distance from shore. Second from left, a figure stands facing away and wearing a long gown. This figure may be male or female. Both arms are down by its side and bent forward, up, and out at the elbows. The figure's hands are raised and may be open with palms facing up.

A group of spirits destined for Purgatory stand on the shore below the mountain, having just arrived in the boat that is now some distance from shore. Third from left, a figure stands facing forward with right leg forward and left leg extended backward. This figure's left foot may be on tiptoe. His or her arms are raised overhead at 135 degrees, bent to the vertical at the elbows. The figure's head is tilted to the right.

A group of spirits destined for Purgatory stand on the shore below the mountain, having just arrived in the boat that is now some distance from shore. Fourth from left, a figure stands facing forward, tilting his or her head back and turning it left. This figure's arms are down and bent across his or her chest. The figure's hands are slightly raised, with palms together. He or she wears a long gown. The shape of this garment's skirts suggests that his or her left leg is extended backward.

A group of spirits destined for Purgatory stand on the shore below the mountain, having just arrived in the boat that is now some distance from shore. Fifth from left, one stands facing right and possibly turning his or her head away. This figure's right arm may be bent across his or her torso. He or she wears a long gown.

A group of spirits destined for Purgatory stand on the shore below the mountain, having just arrived in the boat that is now some distance from shore. Fifth from left, one stands facing right and possibly turning his or her head away. Faint lines to the right of this figure suggest a sixth standing figure. Other features of this figure are impossible to discern.

A group of spirits destined for Purgatory stand on the shore below the mountain, having just arrived in the boat that is now some distance from shore. Dante and Casella face one another and embrace at the right side of the group. Their indistinct features make their identities difficult to specify. The figure on the left faces right and clasps his friend with bent right arm raised and his lower right arm and hand resting on the other figure's left shoulder. The shape of the long gown he wears suggests that his right leg is extended backwards. The figure on the right faces left and returns the embrace with his left arm wrapped around the first figure's torso. He wears a long gown as well, and seems to extend his left leg backward. The head of the figure on the right may rest on the right shoulder of the figure on the left. Both figures seem to have long curly hair.

A group of spirits destined for Purgatory stand on the shore below the mountain, having just arrived in the boat that is now some distance from shore. To the right of the group, and a short distance from them, Virgil stands facing left. He wears a long gown and seems to have long hair.

lg.l: Purga Canto 2 The inscription is very faint; it may have been partly erased. Our reading is conjectural.
Cato The inscription appears above the head of the left-most figure.

desc.objtitle:
The Ascent of the Mountain of Purgatory The Ascent on the Way to Purgatory,
Object 76 (Butlin 812.74)

objnote.p: Inscribed on the verso, "Pg Canto 8" bottom right. This inscription is not by Blake.

illustration.illusobjdesc: This scene takes place on the side of the mountain of Purgatory, which rises precipitously through the left side of the design. A craggy path winds up the side of the mountain, extending from the bottom edge of the design into the upper left corner. The sea is visible between the right edge of the design and the mountain on the left. Light and shadow mottle its surface, indicating small rippling waves. An extended patch of light from the sun shines on the water near the horizon, just to the right of the mountain. Wash above the sea and to the right of the mountain indicates the sky. The sun burns in the sky above the waters of the sea. It emits beams of light that brighten the sky around it. A dark cloud or clouds float in the sky and partially hide the sun. Dante and Virgil are shown as they climb the path up the mountain of Purgatory. Dante stands facing away in the lower left corner of the design. He bends to the left at the waist slightly. His bent right arm is raised vertically and his right hand rests palm down on an outcropping of rock at the side of the path. His lower right arm may rest against the rock as well. His left arm is down by his side and bent away at the elbow, and his left hand lies palm down on the path. His left leg seems to be bent and drawn up, resting on a rock to help support his weight; the bottom of his left foot faces out towards the viewer. Virgil stands above, facing forward on the path near the upper left corner of the design. He bends his head and turns it slightly to the right; his mouth is slightly open and his eyes seem to be lowered, perhaps to look at Dante below. His right leg is bent and drawn up, and his right foot rests on tiptoe on a rock in the path. His left leg is down.

component.illusobjdesc: This scene takes place on the side of the mountain of Purgatory, which rises precipitously through the left side of the design. A craggy path winds up the side of the mountain, extending from the bottom edge of the design into the upper left corner.

The sea is visible between the right edge of the design and the mountain on the left. Light and shadow mottle its surface, indicating small rippling waves. An extended patch of light from the sun shines on the water near the horizon, just to the right of the mountain.
Wash above the sea and to the right of the mountain indicates the sky.
The sun burns in the sky above the waters of the sea. It emits beams of light that brighten the sky around it.
A dark cloud or clouds float in the sky and partially hide the sun.

Dante and Virgil are shown as they climb the path up the mountain of Purgatory. Dante stands facing away in the lower left corner of the design. He bends to the left at the waist slightly. His bent right arm is raised vertically and his right hand rests palm down on an outcropping of a rock at the side of the path. His lower right arm may rest against the rock as well. His left arm is down by his side and bent away at the elbow, and his left hand lies palm down on the path. His left leg seems to be bent and drawn up, resting on a rock to help support his weight; the bottom of his left foot faces out towards the viewer. His bent right leg is down and his right foot is on tiptoe. He wears a transparent gown and has long curly hair. He casts a small shadow on the path below his right foot, and a larger one on the rock to the right, beside the path.

Dante and Virgil are shown as they climb the path up the mountain of Purgatory. Virgil stands facing forward on the path, near the upper left corner of the design. He bends his head and turns it slightly to the right; his mouth is slightly open and his eyes seem to be lowered, perhaps to look at Dante below. His right leg is bent and drawn up, and his right foot rests on tiptoe on a rock in the path. His left leg is down. His right arm is raised almost vertically and his right hand grasps a rock above Virgil's head. His left arm is down and rests against his side. He has long curly hair and wears a transparent gown.

desc.objtitle:
The Rest on the Mountain Leading to Purgatory The Rest on the Way to Purgatory,
Object 77 (Butlin 812.73 recto)

objnote.p: The lower left corner of the design bears part of the collection stamp of the National Gallery of Victoria. Inscribed on the verso, "64" top right, "N 31 next at p 67" top center, the latter partly erased in the center of the sheet, and "Hell Canto 20" along the right margin. These inscriptions are not by Blake.

illustration.illusobjdesc: This scene takes place on the mountain leading to Purgatory. The nearly flat ledge of a cliff fills much of the lower half of the design, dropping off sharply about three quarters of the way across the design from the left edge. This rock outcropping slants more gently downward towards the lower left corner of the design. The mountain itself continues up the left side of the design, though it is here only sketched lightly in pencil. Several boulders lie tumbled where the base of the wall meets the ledge. The horizontal surface of the ledge is covered with grass or moss. A rock path cut into the cliff is just visible at the lower left edge of the design. A sliver of sea appears at the right side of the design, visible between the right edge and the cliff. Its surface ripples with small waves. Wash above the sea and the ledge suggests the sky. Clouds cross the top edge of the design and trail down towards the ledge itself. A smaller cloud or misty puff of vapor is visible just beyond the edge of the ledge. Dante and Virgil sit together on the ledge at the base of the mountain wall, to the left of the tumbled boulders. Both figures, which are impossible to tell apart, sit facing forward with their knees drawn up to their chests. The figure on the left holds his right arm out at 45 degrees.

component.illusobjdesc: This scene takes place on the mountain leading to Purgatory. The nearly flat ledge of a cliff fills much of the lower half of the design, dropping off sharply about three quarters of the way across the design from the left edge. This rock outcropping slants more gently downward towards the lower left corner of the design. The mountain itself continues up the left side of the design, though it is here only sketched lightly in pencil. Several boulders lie tumbled where the base of the wall meets the ledge.
The horizontal surface of the ledge is covered with grass or moss.
A rock path cut into the cliff is just visible at the lower left edge of the design.
A sliver of the sea appears at the right side of the design, visible between the right edge and the cliff. Its surface ripples with small waves.
Wash above the sea and the ledge suggests the sky.
Clouds cross most of the top edge of the design and trail down towards the ledge itself. A smaller cloud or misty puff of vapor is visible just beyond the edge of the ledge.

Dante and Virgil sit together on the ledge at the base of the mountain wall, to the left of the tumbled boulders. Both figures, which are impossible to tell apart, sit facing forward with their knees drawn up to their chests. The figure on the left holds his right arm out at 45 degrees.

desc.objtitle:
The Souls of Those Who Only Repented at the Point of Death The Souls of Those Who Only Repented at Point of Death,
Object 78 (Butlin 812.75 recto)

objnote.p: Inscribed on the verso, "51" top right, "N 34 next at p 83" top center, the latter partly erased in the center of the sheet, and "Hell Canto 21" along the right margin. These inscriptions are not by Blake.

illustration.illusobjdesc: This scene takes place on the mountain of Purgatory, which fills the right edge of the design. A narrow rocky ledge clings to the side of the mountain just below the midpoint of its visible section. A path may run along this ledge. Below the ledge, the mountain's slope becomes gentler. The sea is visible between the left edge of the design and mountain on the right. Wash above the sea and to the left of the mountain suggests the sky. Virgil stands on the ledge at the right side of the design. He wears a long transparent gown, which reveals that his legs face left; he twists forward slightly at the waist. His arms are by his side, bent up and out at the elbows. His hands are raised with the palms facing forward and up. Dante stands to the right of Virgil on the same ledge, but faces away and to the right. His right leg is slightly forward, while his left is extended backwards and his left foot is on tiptoe. He bends his head back and raises both arms vertically overhead. His hands are open; the right palm faces up and the left seems to face away. A cloud rises from the lower right corner and loops counter-clockwise through the design. It begins to dissipate as it crosses the top of the design, and soon separates into three smaller columns that trail towards the lower left corner. Spirits of those who failed to repent until near death fly within the cloud, beginning in the upper right corner. The first spirits are only faintly visible; they become increasingly clear as the column or cloud of vapor circles left and down. The first two spirits, near the upper right corner of the design, fly with horizontal bodies facing down and heads bent back to look left. They are penciled very lightly. Third from right appears the first spirit who is more clearly delineated, facing forward with her body nearly horizontal, her right arm bent up, and her long hair flying around her head. Fourth from left a spirit flies with his body pointing diagonally downward to the left. He is more clearly delineated than the spirits nearest the upper right corner. His head is bent back to look left and down, but his torso faces away; his legs are bent. He holds the left arm of the figure below. Below him to the right a quite clearly delineated female spirit flies with her body in a similar diagonal position. Her torso faces down, but she bends back and twists to the right at the waist, so that her shoulders and breasts face forward. Her arms are spread wide. The figure of another clearly defined spirit crosses the horizon line where the cloud nears the left edge of the design. Her shoulders and breast face partly out towards the viewer, but she bends backwards and twists at the waist so that her pelvis faces up. Her head is bent back and up to the right, and her arms are spread wide. Above her another female spirit, drawn lightly in pencil, flies or hovers with her body facing down to the right, but her head bent back to look left. Her left leg extends up to the right, and her arms are spread wide. A male spirit in the lower left corner is delineated perhaps most clearly of the entire grouping. He is upside down and curled rightward, with his bent legs extending up and over to the right, and his torso facing away and up. His arms are spread wide. Above him to the right, a clearly drawn female spirit flies or hovers with her torso roughly horizontal. Her pelvis faces down but her upper body twists to face forward. Her bent legs are extended up to the left, though they curve around to the right. Her bent arms are raised to either side of her body. Third from the lower left corner, another clearly drawn female spirit flies or hovers with her body nearly upright. Her lower body faces forward, down, and to the right, but she bends backwards and twists sharply away at the waist, so that her shoulders are seen from behind. She turns her head left and raises her right arm nearly vertically. Her left arm is drawn back and raised at 45 degrees. To the right of this spirit, a clearly drawn female spirit flies or hovers nearly upright, with her lower body facing right but her upper body twisted to face forward and left. Both her arms are by her side, bent up at the elbow with open hands raised. She partly hides the figure of another female spirit whose body faces right and slightly forward. This spirit raises her left arm vertically and holds her raised left hand open. She bends backwards at the waist and at least her right leg extends down to the left. Three more spirits cluster together at the end of the semi-circular column. A male spirit is visible just below Virgil's feet, facing right and bending his head back to look up at Virgil. His slightly bent right leg extends backwards with the foot on tiptoe, and his right arm is bent up at the elbow. To the left of this spirit, a more faintly drawn spirit faces away, with her head tilted back and turned up to the right. Her legs also extend down to the left. A male spirit is just visible between this female spirit and one fifth from the lower left corner. This male faces right and raises his eyes, perhaps to look at Virgil above. His right arm is down and bent across his chest, while his legs extend behind him to the left.

component.illusobjdesc: This scene takes place on the mountain of Purgatory, which fills the right edge of the design. A narrow rocky ledge clings to the side of the mountain just below the midpoint of its visible section. A path may run along this ledge. Below the ledge, the mountain's slope becomes gentler.
Grass or moss covers the horizontal surface of the ledge and perhaps the sides of the cliff.
The sea is visible between the left edge of the design and the mountain on the right. Small waves ripple the surface of the water, especially near the lower left corner.
Wash above the sea and to the left of the mountain suggests the sky.

Virgil stands on the ledge at the right side of the design. He wears a long transparent gown, which reveals that his legs face left; he twists forward slightly at the waist. His arms are by his side, bent up and out at the elbows. His hands are raised with the palms facing forward and up. He has long curly hair. His head is down, and his mouth may be open.

Dante stands to the right of Virgil on the same ledge, but faces away and to the right. He wears a long transparent gown. His right leg is slightly forward, while his left is extended backwards and his left foot is on tiptoe. He bends his head back and raises both arms vertically overhead. His hands are open; the right palm faces up and the left seems to face away. He has long hair.

A cloud rises from the lower right corner and loops counter-clockwise through the design. It begins to dissipate as it crosses the top of the design, and soon separates into three smaller columns that trail towards the lower left corner.

A column of vapor rises from the lower right corner and circles counter-clockwise through the design. Spirits of those who failed to repent until near death fly within the cloud, beginning in the upper right corner. The first spirits are only faintly visible. The first spirit, nearest the upper right corner of the design, flies with horizontal body facing down. The spirit's head, bent back to look left, is at the left while his or her legs extend to the right. At least one arm is raised before the spirit's face, perhaps with open palm facing up. The spirit may have long hair and may wear a gown. Other features of this lightly penciled figure are impossible to determine.

A column of vapor rises from the lower right corner and circles counter-clockwise through the design. Spirits of those who failed to repent until near death fly within the cloud, beginning in the upper right corner. The first spirits are only faintly visible. The spirit second from left near the top of the design flies with body largely horizontal, but bent backwards at the waist so that his or her upper body faces slightly left. This spirit may wear a gown. Other features of this lightly penciled figure are impossible to determine.

A column of vapor rises from the lower right corner and circles counter-clockwise through the design. Spirits of those who failed to repent until near death fly within the cloud, beginning in the upper right corner. The first spirits are only faintly visible. Third from right appears the first spirit who is more clearly delineated. She flies with her body horizontal and facing forward, bending to the right slightly at the waist. Her head is bent even more sharply right. Her slightly bent legs extend to the right. Her right arm is down, bent towards her torso at the elbow. Long curly hair flies around her face. Her eyes are lowered or closed and her mouth may be open. She is nude.

A column of vapor rises from the lower right corner and circles counter-clockwise through the design. Spirits of those who failed to repent until near death fly within the cloud, beginning in the upper right corner. Fourth from left a spirit flies with his body pointing diagonally downward to the left. He is more clearly delineated than the spirits nearest the upper right corner. His head is bent back so that he looks left and down. His torso faces away. His legs are bent forward and drawn up slightly; his left foot is pointed into tiptoe position. His left arm is extended down to the left, and he grasps the elbow of a spirit below and to the left with his left hand. He is nude and balding, with short curly hair circling his head.

A column of vapor rises from the lower right corner and circles counter-clockwise through the design. Spirits of those who failed to repent until near death fly within the cloud, beginning in the upper right corner. Fourth from left a spirit flies with his body pointing diagonally downward to the left. Below him to the right, a nude female spirit flies with her body in a similar position. Unlike the spirits nearer the upper right corner of the design, she is quite clearly delineated. Her torso faces down but she bends back and twists to the right at the waist, so that her shoulders and breasts face forward. She tilts her head back and turns it right, so that her face is visible in three-quarters profile looking right. Her left leg is turned out so that the knee faces forward; it extends up to the right. She holds her arms spread wide, with her left arm extended up to the right and her right arm reaching down. Both of her hands are open with the palms facing down. Her eyes are raised and her hair seems to be drawn up into a bun on the top of her head, from which tendrils of long hair escape.

A column of vapor rises from the lower right corner and circles counter-clockwise through the design. Spirits of those who failed to repent until near death fly within the cloud, beginning in the upper right corner. The figure of a female spirit crosses the horizon line where the cloud nears the left edge of the design. She is delineated well. Her body is positioned on a diagonal with her head lower left. Her shoulders and visible breasts face partly out towards the viewer, but she bends backwards and twists at the waist so that her pelvis faces up. Her slightly bent right leg extends up to the right. Her left leg, visible only to the knee, is next to the right. Her head is bent back and turned up to the right slightly; her eyes are raised and her mouth may be open. Her arms are spread wide: she reaches her right arm down to the left at 45 degrees and raises her left arm up at 135 degrees. Her lower left arm rests along the forearm of the spirit above her; she holds his forearm near the elbow with her left hand. Her long curly hair blows up to the right. She seems to wear a transparent gown or loosely fitted garment that sweeps over her right arm, billows behind her shoulders, and trails past her feet.

A column of vapor rises from the lower right corner and circles counter-clockwise through the design. Spirits of those who failed to repent until near death fly within the cloud, beginning in the upper right corner. The figure of a female spirit crosses the horizon line where the cloud nears the left edge of the design. Another female spirit, drawn lightly in pencil, flies above her to the left. Her body faces down and to the right, but her head is bent back to look down to the left. She also bends backwards slightly at the waist. At least her left leg extends up to the right, with her left foot in tiptoe position. Her right arm extends down to the left at 45 degrees, while her left arm is raised to the right, at an angle slightly higher than horizontal. Her long hair flies around her head. She may be nude, and seems to have visible breasts. She may hold a round object in her left hand.

A column of vapor rises from the lower right corner and circles counter-clockwise through the design. Spirits of those who failed to repent until near death fly within the cloud, beginning in the upper right corner. A clearly delineated male spirit is visible near the lower left corner of the design, upside down and curled rightward. His lower body faces away and slightly left. His bent legs are together, curving up to the right with his feet pointed into tiptoes. He twists and bends to the right at the waist so that his upper body faces away and up. His arms are spread wide, with his bent left arm raised vertically and his bent right arm extended horizontally to the right. Both hands are open, with his left palm facing away and to the right, and his right palm facing away and up. He has short curly hair and wears a transparent gown that extends past his feet.

A column of vapor rises from the lower right corner and circles counter-clockwise through the design. Spirits of those who failed to repent until near death fly within the cloud, beginning in the upper right corner. A clearly drawn female spirit flies or hovers second from left in the lower left corner. Her torso is roughly horizontal, but her pelvis faces down and her upper body twists to face forward. Her legs are bent and extend up to the left; she bends backwards at the waist. The soles of both feet are visible. Her bent right arm is raised up to the left. Her right hand is open with the palm facing forward. Her left arm is by her side, but bent up and out to the right at the elbow. Her left hand is open with the palm facing up. The fingers of this hand nearly touch the fingers of the spirit to the right. She turns her head to look up to the left, so that her face is visible in three-quarters profile. Her eyes are raised. Her long curly hair blows up to the left. She wears a transparent gown that swirls around her legs.

A column of vapor rises from the lower right corner and circles counter-clockwise through the design. Spirits of those who failed to repent until near death fly within the cloud, beginning in the upper right corner. A clearly drawn spirit third in line from the lower left corner of the design flies with her body nearly upright. Her lower body faces forward, down, and to the right, but she bends backwards and twists sharply away at the waist, so that her shoulders are seen from behind. She turns her head left; her face is visible in profile looking left and down. She raises her slightly bent right arm up nearly vertically. Her raised right hand is open with the palm facing away and up. Her slightly bent left arm is drawn back and raised at 45 degrees, extended left towards the spirit to the left. Her left hand is open with the palm facing out to the left. The tips of the fingers on this hand nearly touch the fingers of the spirit to the left. Her legs are together, right leg crossed behind the left at the calf. At least her left foot is pointed into tiptoes. She wears a transparent gown, which is most visible where it swirls around her legs and feet. She has short curly hair.

A column of vapor rises from the lower right corner and circles counter-clockwise through the design. Spirits of those who failed to repent until near death fly within the cloud, beginning in the upper right corner. The clearly drawn female spirit fourth in line from the lower left corner flies or hovers with her body nearly upright. Her lower body faces right, but she twists forward and left and bends left slightly. Her right leg is bent backwards. Both of her arms are by her side, bent up at the elbow with open hands raised and palms facing forward. She turns her head slightly to the left. She wears a long gown that billows around her legs. Her long curly hair flies around her head. Her mouth may be open slightly.

A column of vapor rises from the lower right corner and circles counter-clockwise through the design. Spirits of those who failed to repent until near death fly within the cloud, beginning in the upper right corner. The female spirit fourth in line from the lower left corner flies or hovers with her body nearly upright, her lower body facing right and her upper body facing forward. Just to the right, another female spirit hovers or flies facing right and slightly forward. She is partly hidden by the female spirit to the left. Her left arm is raised vertically and she holds her left hand open with the palm facing up and left. She bends backward at the waist and at least her right leg extends down to the left, with her foot pointed into tiptoe. Her head is bent back and her mouth is open. She has long curly hair, and may wear a gown.

A column of vapor rises from the lower right corner and circles counter-clockwise through the design. Spirits of those who failed to repent until near death fly within the cloud, beginning in the upper right corner. A spirit at the end of the semi-circular column flies or hovers just below Virgil's feet. This spirit faces right but bends his head back to look up at Virgil above. His slightly bent right leg extends backward and his right foot is pointed into tiptoe. His right arm is by his side, bent up at the elbow with his open hand raised. His open left hand is visible raised just to the right of his right hand. Both palms may face up. He has long curly hair and a long beard, and wears a semi-transparent gown with a belt or otherwise defined waistline.

A column of vapor rises from the lower right corner and circles counter-clockwise through the design. Spirits of those who failed to repent until near death fly within the cloud, beginning in the upper right corner. A male spirit at the end of the semi-circular column flies or hovers just below Virgil's feet. Just to the left of this spirit, a female spirit flies or hovers facing away. She is penciled more lightly than the figures in the lower left corner of the design. She tilts her head back and turns it right, to look up at Virgil above; her face is visible in partial profile. Her mouth seems to be open. She bends backwards and twists her lower body rightward at the waist; her legs extend together down to the left. At least her right foot may be pointed into tiptoes. Her arms are by her side and bent up at the elbows with open hands raised and palms facing out. She wears a gown with a belt or a well-defined waistline. Her long hair is swept around over her left shoulder.

A column of vapor rises from the lower right corner and circles counter-clockwise through the design. Spirits of those who failed to repent until near death fly within the cloud, beginning in the upper right corner. Two spirits at the end of the semi-circular column fly or hover just below Virgil's feet. Just to the left of leftmost of these, a third spirit is partly visible, drawn lightly in pencil. He faces right and raises his eyes, perhaps to look at Virgil above. His right arm is down and bent across his chest. He bends backwards at the waist and extends at least his right leg down behind him to the left. His right foot is pointed into tiptoe position. He has a curly beard and may have long hair. He seems to wear a gown.

desc.objtitle:
The Lawn with the Kings and Angels The Valley of Negligent Rulers,
Object 79 (Butlin 812.76)

objnote.p: Inscribed on the verso, "33" top right, "N 44 next at p 52" top center, the latter partly erased in the center of the sheet, and "Vanni Fucci Hell Canto 25" along the right margin. These inscriptions are not by Blake.

illustration.illusobjdesc: This scene takes place in a dell on the side of the mountain of Purgatory. The base or floor of the dell runs horizontally across most of the length of the bottom of the design, and seems to be covered with grass or indeterminate small leafy vegetation. A mountain range appears above the dell and extends horizontally from one side of the design to the other. A path leads through the vegetation at the far side of the dell. It begins near the right edge of the design, and slants diagonally down to the left to meet the grass in the hollow. Trees grow on the far side of the hollow. Their trunks rise in an irregular line above the group of figures seated beneath their foliage, which ranges from tiny leaves to large flower-like leaves. One tree just to the left of center also bears small round berries, buds, or nuts. A bare path leads into the dell from the bottom edge of the design. Three short trees grow in the lower right corner of the design, to the right of the path. Their tiny trunks branch into limbs that support a leafy canopy. Other indeterminate leafy vegetation fills the space of the corner. At least four short trees grow in the lower left corner of the design, to the left of the path. Like those on the right side, their tiny trunks lift branches that support thickly leaved canopies. Flowers, perhaps anemones, bloom to the left of the path. Other indeterminate leafy vegetation fills the spaces of the lower left corner. Mixed leafy vegetation grows in the roughly triangular space between the right edge of the design, the right side of the path, and the edge of the dell. Palm fronds are visible right at the edge of the path. Dante and Virgil stand or walk near the center of the bottom edge of the design, on the path that leads into the dell. Dante, on the right, faces away and left. His left leg is bent and extended backwards, with his left foot on tiptoe. His left arm is down and seems to be bent across his chest. Virgil, on the left, faces away and slightly left. His left leg is bent and extended backwards, with his left foot on tiptoe. Sordello, the Mantuan minstrel, hovers just above the ground to the right of Dante. He faces away and to the left with his legs extended backwards and his feet pointed into tiptoe position. His left arm is down by his side and bent slightly forward. His right arm is visible from shoulder to elbow, where it is bent forward. A scaly snake undulates on the path near the right edge of the design. Its head is curled up and back over its body, facing right. Its mouth is open and a forked tongue emerges. Horns or a crest grows on its head. Two angels hover or fly in the sky above the scene, crossing the swords they hold in a protective gesture. The angel on the left faces forward and slightly right. She bends backwards at the waist, and her legs extend away and to the left. Her right arm is by her side, bent up at the elbow with her raised right hand open and vertical palm forward. Her left arm is extended roughly horizontally. She holds the grip of her downward pointed sword with this hand. Her wings are spread wide on either side of her body. A halo of light circles her head. The angel on the right is seen from behind. Her upper body faces away and to the right, but she bends backwards and to the right at the waist so that her lower body faces down. Her legs extend out towards the viewer and curl away to the right. The soles of both feet are visible. Her left hand appears just beneath the base of her left wing, holding the grip of her sword, which points down to the left. Her large wings are spread wide. Like her counterpart, a halo of light circles her head. Rivulets of flame run down the blades of the swords the angels hold, ending in wispy sparks at their tips. A group of twenty or twenty-one spirits sit in a depression beneath the trees at the far side of the dell. These are spirits who, busy with earthly power during life, put off repentance until near death. Several wear royal garb; one is dressed in a monk's hood.

component.illusobjdesc: This scene takes place in a dell on the side of the mountain of Purgatory. The base or floor of the dell runs horizontally across most of the length of the bottom of the design.
The base or floor of the dell that runs horizontally across most of the length of the design seems to be covered with grass or indeterminate small leafy vegetation.
A mountain range appears above the dell and extends horizontally from one side of the design to the other.
A path leads through the vegetation at the far side of the dell. It begins near the right edge of the design, and slants diagonally down to the left to meet the grass in the hollow.

Trees grow on the far side of the hollow. Their trunks rise in an irregular line above the group of figures seated beneath their foliage, which ranges from tiny leaves to large flower-like leaves. One tree just to the left of center also bears small round berries, buds, or nuts.
A bare path leads into the dell from the center of the bottom edge of the design.

Three short trees grow in the lower right corner of the design, to the right of the path. Their tiny trunks branch into limbs that support a leafy canopy. Other indeterminate leafy vegetation fills the space of the corner.

At least four short trees grow in the lower left corner of the design, to the left of the path. Like those on the right side, their tiny trunks lift branches that support thickly leaved canopies. Flowers, perhaps anemones, bloom to the left of the path. Other indeterminate leafy vegetation fills the spaces of the lower left corner.

Mixed leafy vegetation grows in the roughly triangular space between the right edge of the design, the right side of the path, and the edge of the dell. Palm fronds are visible right at the edge of the path.

Dante and Virgil stand or walk near the center of the bottom edge of the design, on the path that leads into the dell. Dante, on the right, faces away and left. His left leg is bent and extended backwards, with his left foot on tiptoe. His left arm is down and seems to be bent across his chest. He wears a long gown, and has long curly hair.

Dante and Virgil stand or walk near the center of the bottom edge of the design, on the path that leads into the dell. Virgil, on the left, faces away and slightly left. His left leg is bent and extended backwards, with his left foot on tiptoe. Neither arm is clearly visible. He has long curly hair, and wears a long gown.

Sordello, the Mantuan minstrel, hovers just above the ground to the right of Dante. He faces away and to the left with his legs extended backwards and his feet pointed into tiptoe position. His left arm is down by his side and bent slightly forward. His left hand is open with the palm vertical. His right arm is visible from shoulder to elbow, where it is bent forward. He wears a long gown and has short hair.

A scaly snake undulates on the path near the right edge of the design. Its head is curled up and back over its body, facing right. Its mouth is open and a forked tongue emerges. Horns or a crest grows on its head.

Two angels hover or fly in the sky above the scene, crossing the swords they hold in a protective gesture. The angel on the left faces forward and slightly right. She bends backwards at the waist, and her legs extend away and to the left. Her left leg may be bent at the knee; her right foot may be pointed into tiptoe position. Her right arm is by her side, bent up at the elbow with her raised right hand open and vertical palm forward. Her left arm is extended roughly horizontally. She holds the grip of her downward pointed sword with this hand. Her wings are spread wide on either side of her body. She wears a long gown that swirls around her legs and billows past her feet. She has short curly hair. A halo of light circles her head.

Two angels hover or fly in the sky above the scene, crossing the swords they hold in a protective gesture. The angel on the right is seen from behind. Her upper body faces away and to the right, but she bends backwards and to the right at the waist so that her lower body faces down. Her legs extend out towards the viewer and curl away to the right. The soles of both feet are visible. Her face is visible in partial profile looking down. Her left hand appears just beneath the base of her left wing, holding the grip of her sword, which points down to the left. Her large wings are spread wide. She wears a long gown that billows around her legs. She has short curly hair. A halo of light circles her head.

Two angels hover or fly in the sky above the scene, crossing the swords they hold in a protective gesture over the figures below. Rivulets of flame run down the blades of both swords, ending in wispy sparks at their tips.

A group of twenty or twenty-one spirits sit in a depression beneath the trees at the far side of the dell. These are spirits who, busy with earthly power during life, put off repentance until near death. At the far left of the grouping, a spirit wearing the garb of a king sits facing forward and to the right. His legs are bent forward beneath the long gown he wears. His right arm is down by his side and bent forward; he may rest his elbow, lower arm, and hand on the higher ground to the left. He wears a crown on his head. A cloak, cape, or similar garment circles his neck and drapes down to the right, over his gown. He has long hair and a beard.

A group of twenty or twenty-one spirits sit in a depression beneath the trees at the far side of the dell. These are spirits who, busy with earthly power during life, put off repentance until near death. At the far left of the grouping, a spirit wearing the garb of a king sits facing forward and to the right. To the right of the king, the head and part of the upper body of another well-dressed figure is visible facing forward and left. This figure wears a crown-like headdress or helmet. This head covering may also be the hood of a cloak, gown, or similar garment cinched beneath the wearer's chin. The figure may be royalty, or if male, may be a knight.

A group of twenty or twenty-one spirits sit in a depression beneath the trees at the far side of the dell. These are spirits who, busy with earthly power during life, put off repentance until near death. Third from left the head of one of these spirits is visible looking forward and slightly left above the figures of other spirits. This spirit has a beard and wears a hood or helmet with an ornament over his forehead. His head may be tilted back slightly. His eyes are raised and his mouth may be open. He may be a knight or a king.

A group of twenty spirits or twenty-one sit in a depression beneath the trees at the far side of the dell. These are spirits who, busy with earthly power during life, put off repentance until near death. At the far left of the grouping, a spirit wearing the garb of a king sits facing forward and to the right. Below him to the right sits a spirit wearing the cowled robe of a monk. This spirit also sits facing forward and slightly right, with his legs bent beneath his robe. His slightly bent right arm is down by his side; his upper left arm is also down. The hood of his robe is pulled up around his head to cover his ears. His eyes are raised and his mouth is open slightly. The top of his tonsured head is bald, but short hair is visible at his right temple.

A group of twenty or twenty-one spirits sit in a depression beneath the trees at the far side of the dell. These are spirits who, busy with earthly power during life, put off repentance until near death. A monk sits facing forward near the left side of the group. To the right of the monk sits a spirit dressed as a king, facing forward and slightly right. His arms are hidden beneath his voluminous gown. The shape of this garment suggests that his right leg is bent forward and his left leg is extended down to the right. He wears a crown on his head, and has a beard and long hair.

A group of twenty or twenty-one spirits sit in a depression beneath the trees at the far side of the dell. These are spirits who, busy with earthly power during life, put off repentance until near death. A monk and a king sit side-by-side facing forward and slightly right near the left side of the group. The head of another figure is visible between their heads. This head faces forward and has a beard. He seems to be bald.

A group of twenty or twenty-one spirits sit in a depression beneath the trees at the far side of the dell. These are spirits who, busy with earthly power during life, put off repentance until near death. One seated female(?) spirit with long hair is visible just to the left of Virgil. Seen partly from behind, the figure turns her head left so that her face is visible in profile. She wears a gown. The figure's left arm is down but bent at the elbow. Her leg is also bent.

A group of twenty or twenty-one spirits sit in a depression beneath the trees at the far side of the dell. These are spirits who, busy with earthly power during life, put off repentance until near death. One seated spirit with long hair is visible just to the left of Virgil. The head of a bearded figure is visible to the left of this long-haired figure. This bearded figure looks forward and left. Only his head and part of his torso are visible. His mouth may be open. He seems to be bald, though he may have short hair around the sides of his head.

A group of twenty or twenty-one spirits sit in a depression beneath the trees at the far side of the dell. These are spirits who, busy with earthly power during life, put off repentance until near death. To the left of Virgil one of these spirits sits facing right and slightly away, with bowed head. The figure's right arm is down but bent across his or her torso at the elbow with hand raised and perhaps resting on his or her chest. The figure wears a cloak or hood drawn up over his or her head and falling down past his or her shoulders, over a gown or similar garment.

A group of twenty or twenty-one spirits sit in a depression beneath the trees at the far side of the dell. These are spirits who, busy with earthly power during life, put off repentance until near death. To the left of Virgil one of these spirits sits facing right and slightly away, with bowed head. The faintly penciled head of another spirit is visible above and to the right of this spirit. The head looks forward and left, and may be bald on top with short curly hair at his left temple. He seems to have a long curly beard as well. Alternatively, lines suggestive of beard hair may also be a gown or similar garment.

A group of twenty or twenty-one spirits sit in a depression beneath the trees at the far side of the dell. These are spirits who, busy with earthly power during life, put off repentance until near death. To the left of Virgil one of these spirits sits facing right and slightly away, with bowed head. Above this figure's head, another head looks forward and right. The features of this lightly drawn head are only very faintly suggested.

A group of twenty or twenty-one spirits sit in a depression beneath the trees at the far side of the dell. These are spirits who, busy with earthly power during life, put off repentance until near death. To the left of Virgil one of these spirits sits facing right and slightly away, with head bowed beneath a hood or cloak. Another bowed head, facing away, appears to the left of this first figure. Only the back of this figure's head beneath the hood is visible.

A group of twenty or twenty-one spirits sit in a depression beneath the trees at the far side of the dell. These are spirits who, busy with earthly power during life, put off repentance until near death. A male spirit sits facing left at the far right side of the group, to the right of Sordello. He leans backwards, resting his back against the trunk of a tree. His left arm is by his side, bent up at the elbow with hand raised. His knee, visible just to the left of Sordello, suggests that his leg is bent. He has a beard and long curly hair, and may be wearing a gown.

A group of twenty or twenty-one spirits sit in a depression beneath the trees at the far side of the dell. These are spirits who, busy with earthly power during life, put off repentance until near death. The merest curved outlines above the heads of clearly drawn spirits indicates additional heads, seven or eight in all. One or perhaps two of these are visible between Dante and Virgil. Two more of these are visible above and to the left of Virgil's left shoulder. Four are visible above the rightmost king in the first row of spirits, below the tree that bears berries or nuts.

lg.l: Purg Canto 8 The inscription is extremely faint; it was probably partly erased. Our reading of the words before the number is highly conjectural.

desc.objtitle:
Lucia Carrying Dante in His Sleep Lucia Carries Dante Towards the Entrance to Purgatory,
Object 80 (Butlin 812.77)

objnote.p: Inscribed on the verso, "42" top right, "N23 next at p 52" just below the top margin, and "Capaneus Hell Canto 14" along the right margin. These inscriptions are not by Blake.

illustration.illusobjdesc: This scene takes place on the side of the mountain leading to Purgatory. Several roughly horizontal stony(?) ledges lead up the mountain on the left. Grass covers much of the side of the mountain, especially on the roughly horizontal surfaces of the ledges. To the right of the mountain, dark wash fills the design and surrounds the figures. Especially dark near the upper left corner, it suggests the night sky near dawn. Nine stars are scattered throughout. A full, large moon glows near the darkest part of the sky at the top edge of the design, behind the heads of two of the figures. The rising sun just peeks into the design in the lower right corner. It sends beams of light across the sky, which is lightest nearby. Four stunted trees grow on a ledge in the lower left corner of the design. Their leafy canopies seem to merge together above a few visible branches. Two small trees or stalky flowering plants grow side-by-side on a ledge above these four trees. The larger of these may have lily-like blooms. A tree or plant grows up the side of a ledge above and to the right of the four stunted trees in the lower left corner of the design. From roots to leaves, it seems to merge with or lie right on top of the stone. To the right of this vegetation, another small tree with large leaves on its branches grows. Another leaf lies on the ground a little farther down this ledge to the right. Indeterminate leafy or flowering vegetation grows close to the ground on the left and right of the rightmost tree in the lower left corner. Similar vegetation grows along the ground to the right of the sparsely leaved tree above and to the right. Lucia carries Dante up the side of the mountain. He sleeps in her embrace as she moves lightly upward. She faces left, though her torso is turned slightly out toward the viewer. Her left leg is bent and drawn forward and up; the toes of her pointed left foot just touch the grass growing on the mountain rock. Her right leg is extended behind her, with the foot pointed. Her bent left arm is down and wrapped around Dante's legs, supporting them, and her left hand is tucked partly behind his knees. Her right forearm and hand are bent upward and raised behind Dante's shoulders and head, cradling him close. His head rests on her breast and shoulder beneath her chin, with his face facing forward and right. His body extends to the right. His legs are bent. His right arm is down and bent, resting across his lap. His eyes are closed. Lucia's head is bent down towards him and may rest on his head. The luminous moon forms a halo around their heads. Virgil is shown near the lower right corner of the design, climbing the mountain after Lucia and Dante. He faces left though his torso is turned slightly out towards the viewer, and steps forward with his bent right leg. His bent left leg is extended behind him, and his left foot is on tiptoe. His left arm is at his side, bent slightly. His right arm is also down, but bent forward; his right hand rests on his right knee, and both arm and hand may be braced against this leg to support his climb. He bends his head back and raises his eyes to look at Lucia above.

component.illusobjdesc: This scene takes place on the side of the mountain leading to Purgatory. Several roughly horizontal stony(?) ledges lead up the mountain on the left.
Grass covers much of the side of the mountain, especially on the roughly horizontal surfaces of the ledges.

To the right of the mountain, dark wash fills the design and surrounds the figures. Especially dark near the upper left corner, it suggests the night sky near dawn. Nine stars are scattered throughout.
A full, large moon glows near the darkest part of the sky at the top edge of the design, behind the heads of two of the figures.
The rising sun just peeks into the design in the lower right corner. It sends beams of light across the sky, which is lightest nearby.
Four stunted trees grow on a ledge in the lower left corner of the design. Their leafy canopies seem to merge together above a few visible branches.

Two small trees or stalky flowering plants grow side-by-side on a ledge above the four stunted trees in the lower left corner of the design. The larger of these bears what may be amaryllis or lily-like blooms.

A tree or plant grows up the side of a ledge above and to the right of the four stunted trees in the lower left corner of the design. From roots to leaves, it seems to merge with or lie right on top of the stone. It sends branches or tendrils rightward.
Two ledges over to the right from the four stunted trees in the lower left corner grows another small tree with large leaves on its branches.

Two ledges over to the right from the four stunted trees in the lower left corner grows another small tree with sparser leaves on its branches. Another leaf lies on the ground a little farther down this ledge to the right.

Four stunted trees grow on a ledge in the lower left corner of the design. Indeterminate leafy or flowering vegetation grows close to the ground on the left and right of the rightmost tree. Similar vegetation grows along the ground to the right of the sparsely leaved tree above and to the right.

Lucia carries Dante up the side of the mountain. He sleeps in her embrace as she moves lightly upward. She faces left, though her torso is turned slightly out towards the viewer. Her left leg is bent and drawn forward and up; the toes of her pointed left foot just touch the grass growing on the mountain rock. Her right leg is extended behind her, with the foot pointed. Her graceful position on tiptoe conveys the impression that she floats as much as steps upwards. Her bent left arm is down and wrapped around Dante's legs, supporting them, and her left hand is tucked partly behind his knees. Her right forearm and hand are bent upward and raised behind Dante's shoulders and head, cradling him close. His head lies on her breast, beneath her chin, which she may rest against his temple. Her head is bent down towards him. She has long curly hair, and wears a semi-transparent gown that billows behind her to the right. The luminous moon forms a halo around their heads.

Lucia carries Dante up the side of the mountain. He sleeps in her embrace as she moves lightly upward. His head rests on her breast and shoulder beneath her chin, with his face facing forward and right. His body extends to the right. His legs are bent. His right arm is down and bent, resting across his lap. He wears a long gown. His eyes are closed. The luminous moon forms a halo around their heads.

Virgil is shown near the lower right corner of the design, climbing the mountain after Lucia and Dante. He faces left though his torso is turned slightly out toward the viewer, and steps forward with his bent right leg. His bent left leg is extended behind him, and his left foot is on tiptoe. His left arm is at his side, bent slightly. His left hand is open with the palm down. His right arm is also down, but bent forward; his right hand rests on his right knee, and both arm and hand may be braced against this leg to support his climb. He bends his head back and raises his eyes to look at Lucia above. He may also bend forward slightly. He has long curly hair, and wears a semi-transparent gown that swirls around his legs.

lg.l: P-g Canto 9 This ink inscription is offset slightly to the left of its pencil under-writing.

desc.objtitle:
Dante and Virgil Approaching the Angel Who Guards the Entrance of Purgatory Dante and Virgil Before the Angelic Guardian of the Gate of Purgatory,
Object 81 (Butlin 812.78)

objnote.p: Inscribed on the verso, "35" top right, and "Pg Canto 9" bottom right. These inscriptions are not by Blake.

illustration.illusobjdesc: This scene takes place before the gateway into Purgatory, at the top of the mountain. The mountain is visible at the bottom of the design, crossing from the lower right edge almost all the way to the lower left edge. It drops off precipitously near the left edge. The wall of Purgatory is visible from the top of the mountain through the right side of the design to the upper right corner. Three steps lead up from the top of the mountain to an arched door or gateway into Purgatory. The lowest step is white marble, the middle step is burned black, and the highest step is a blood-red stone. Shadows fill the doorway above the figure seated within it. A path runs along the outer edge of the mountain to the base of the steps to the gateway into Purgatory. The sea is visible above and to the left of the mountaintop. Waves ripple the water, which also reflects light from above. Wash to the left of the mountain and above the sea indicates the sky at sunrise. The sun appears low in the sky to the left of the wall of Purgatory. Though mostly hidden behind dark clouds, it emits beams of light. A male angel sits within the doorway into Purgatory, facing forward. His knees are bent and drawn up to his chest. His arms are down and his hands may rest on the outside of his ankles. He has long hair and a long beard, though the top of his head may be bald. His folded wings are spread to either side of his body. His head emits beams of light. Dante and Virgil stand together, facing right, to the left of the steps to the doorway. Dante is to the left, and hides Virgil slightly. Dante's head is lowered. His right arm is down but bent up at the elbow across his torso. His right hand is raised to just below his head and may touch his face. His right leg is bent and extended behind him, with his right foot on tiptoe. Like Dante, Virgil bends his head and holds his right arm down but bent up at the elbow across his torso; his right hand is raised and may touch his face. Both Dante and Virgil have long hair and wear long gowns.

component.illusobjdesc: This scene takes place before the gateway into Purgatory, at the top of the mountain. The mountain is visible at the bottom of the design, crossing from the lower right edge almost all the way to the lower left edge. It drops off precipitously near the left edge.
The wall of Purgatory is visible from the top of the mountain through the right side of the design to the upper right corner.

Three steps lead up from the top of the mountain to an arched door or gateway into Purgatory. The lowest step is white marble, the middle step is burned black, and the highest step is a blood-red stone. Shadows fill the doorway above the figure seated within it.
A path runs along the outer edge of the mountain to the base of the steps to the gateway into Purgatory.
The sea is visible above and to the left of the mountaintop. Waves ripple the water, which also reflects light from above.
Wash to the left of the mountain and above the sea indicates the sky at sunrise.
The sun appears low in the sky to the left of the wall of Purgatory. Though mostly hidden behind dark clouds, it emits beams of light.
Dark clouds cover the sun, which appears low in the sky to the left of the wall of Purgatory.

A male angel sits within the doorway into Purgatory. His body faces forward but he turns his head slightly left, perhaps to look at Dante and Virgil to the left. His knees are bent and drawn up to his chest. His arms are down and his hands may rest on the outside of his ankles. He has long hair and a long beard, though the top of his head may be bald. His folded wings are spread to either side of his body. He may be nude. His head emits beams of light.

Dante and Virgil stand together, facing right, to the left of the steps to the doorway. Dante is to the left, and hides Virgil slightly. Dante's head is lowered. His right arm is down but bent up at the elbow across his torso. His right hand is raised to just below his head and may touch his face. His left leg is bent. His right leg is bent and extended behind him, with his right foot on tiptoe. He wears a long gown and has long hair.

Dante and Virgil stand together, facing right, to the left of the steps to the doorway. Virgil is to the right, and hidden by Dante slightly. Like Dante, his head is lowered and his right arm is down but bent up at the elbow across his torso. His right hand is raised and may touch his face. He wears a long gown and seems to have long hair.

desc.objtitle:
The Angel Marking Dante with the Sevenfold P The Angel Marking Dante's Forehead,
Object 82 (Butlin 812.79)

objnote.p: Inscribed on the verso, "36" and "Pg Canto 9" top right. These inscriptions are not by Blake.

illustration.illusobjdesc: This scene takes place at the gateway into Purgatory, on the top of the mountain. The large arched gateway itself fills much of the design, rising through the right edge. Three steps lead up to the door of the gateway. The lowest step is white marble, the middle step is a charred black material, and the highest step is blood-red stone. The doorway is set into the wall of Purgatory, which rises up the right side of the design and extends two-thirds to three-quarters of the way leftward across the design. The path leading up the mountain to the gateway is visible across the bottom of the design. The rocky surface of the mountain top appears between the left edge of the steps to the gateway and the left edge of the design. A segment of the sea is visible between the left edge of the design and the left edge of the wall of Purgatory. Waves ripple its surface, which is dappled with shadow and reflected light. Wash above the horizon line and left of the wall of Purgatory suggests the sky. Dark clouds lower in the sky near the horizon line, to the left of the wall of Purgatory. Lighter clouds are visible nearer the upper left corner of the design. Diagonal lines across the sky in the upper left corner of the design, to the left of the wall of Purgatory, indicate beams of light. They may stream from the sun hidden behind clouds near the top edge of the design. Dante kneels in front of the gateway into Purgatory. He faces right and bends his head back to look up at the angel above. His right arm is by his side, bent up at the elbow in front of his chest. His right hand is raised, vertical palm facing away. Sketched marks to either side of his hand suggest that his left hand is also raised and touches the right in prayer position. His long curly hair falls behind his back and he wears a long gown. A male angel stands to the right of Dante, facing left. He bends his head down and lowers his eyes to look at Dante kneeling before him, and uses the dull point of a sword to write the letters "PPE" for "Peccata" (or "sins") on Dante's forehead. The angel's right forearm is raised and he holds the blade of the sword between the thumb and forefinger of this hand, as if the weapon were a giant pencil. His left arm is by his side but bent up at the elbow, and he holds the sword farther up the blade with his left hand. His large wings are bent up behind his back, and a penciled semi-circle is visible around his head as if he has a halo or emits beams of light. Virgil stands to the right of the angel, facing left towards Dante. His head is bent. His left arm is by his side and bent across his chest. His lower right arm likewise crosses his chest, and he rests his crossed wrists against each other, left over right. Curving lines above these figures may be alternative positions for them.

component.illusobjdesc: This scene takes place at the gateway into Purgatory, on the top of the mountain. The large arched gateway itself fills much of the design, rising through the right edge.
Three steps lead up to the door of the gateway. The lowest step is white marble, the middle step is a charred black material, and the highest step is blood-red stone.
The doorway is set into the wall of Purgatory, which rises up the right side of the design and extends two-thirds to three-quarters of the way leftward across the design.
The path leading up the mountain to the gateway is visible across the bottom of the design
The rocky surface of the mountain top is visible between the left edge of the steps to the gateway and the left edge of the design.
A segment of the sea is visible between the left edge of the design and the left edge of the wall of Purgatory. Waves ripple its surface, which is dappled with shadow and reflected light.
Wash above the horizon line and left of the wall of Purgatory suggests the sky.
Dark clouds lower in the sky near the horizon line, to the left of the wall of Purgatory. Lighter clouds are visible nearer the upper left corner of the design.

Diagonal lines across the sky in the upper left corner of the design, to the left of the wall of Purgatory, indicate beams of light that brighten these areas of the sky. They may stream from the sun hidden behind clouds near the top edge of the design.

Dante kneels in front of the gateway into Purgatory. He faces right and bends his head back to look up at the angel above. His right arm is by his side, bent up at the elbow in front of his chest. His right hand is raised, vertical palm facing away. Sketched marks to either side of his hand suggest that his left hand is also raised and touches the right in prayer position. The letters "PPE" for "Peccata" (or sins) is inscribed in a line on his forehead with the initial "P" repeated. The third letter is unclear and might be yet a third "P." His long curly hair falls behind his back and he wears a long gown.

A male angel stands to the right of Dante, facing left. He bends his head down and lowers his eyes to look at Dante kneeling before him, and uses the dull point of a sword to write the letter "PPE" for "Peccata" (or sins) on Dante's forehead, with the initial "P" repeated. His right forearm is raised and he holds the blade of the sword between the thumb and forefinger of this hand, as if the weapon were a giant pencil. His left arm is by his side but bent up at the elbow, and he holds the sword farther up the blade with his left hand. He wears a long transparent gown, and has long curly hair and a long beard. His large wings are raised behind his back. A penciled semi-circle is visible around the angel's head, as if he has a halo or emits beams of light. Alternatively, these lines may be an alternative position for this figure.

Virgil stands to the right of the angel, facing left towards Dante. His head is bent. His left arm is by his side and bent across his chest. His lower right arm likewise crosses his chest, and he rests his crossed wrists against each other, left over right. He wears a long gown and has long curly hair. His left foot is just visible beneath the hem of his gown. Curving lines above Virgil's head may be an alternative position for him.

lg.l: PPE This inscription appears on Dante's forehead (the kneeling figure). It stands for "Peccata" (or sins), with the "P" repeated. The third letter is unclear and might be yet a third "P."

desc.objtitle:
The Rock Sculptured with the Recovery of the Ark and the Annunciation Dante and Virgil Contemplate the Sculptures in the Rock,
Object 83 (Butlin 812.80)

objnote.p: Inscribed on the verso, "38" top right, and "Pg Canto 12" bottom right. These inscriptions are not by Blake.

illustration.illusobjdesc: This scene takes place on the mountain of Purgatory, which rises through the right side of the design. A stone path edges the mountain, ascending diagonally from the lower right corner of the design before it curves right around the side of the mountain. The path runs along a ledge that becomes a steep cliff on the left side. A dark choppy sea is visible to the left of the mountain. Wash above the horizon line and to the left of the mountain suggests a dark sky, perhaps heavy with clouds. Dante and Virgil stand near each other on the ledge. Dante is left of Virgil. He faces right and tilts his head back to look at the designs in the cliff to the right. His right arm is by his side but bent up at the elbow. Virgil is right of Dante. His body faces away but he turns his head left. His left arm is down by his side. His right arm is by his side but bent up at the elbow. Both wear long gowns. A white marble block carved out of the mountain rises like a cliff face on the right side of the ledge. Relief sculptures show two self-contained scenes carved into the face of the block. The scene on the right presents the Annunciation, with an angel appearing to the Virgin Mary. The angel hovers on the left, surrounded in flame, while Mary sits to the left of a desk or table and gazes up at him. The scene on the left presents the Recovery of the Ark of the Covenant. The ark itself sits in an ox-cart drawn by two oxen. Two angels hover over the ark, in positions reminiscent of carvings said to surmount the ark's lid. King David dances at the head of the procession, beneath a window from which his wife Michal watches. A crowd has gathered above the oxen. Meanwhile Uzzah, an Israelite who was punished for touching the Ark of the Covenant, is shown in the instant of punishment at the rear of the procession. Lightning strikes him in the chest as he bends or falls backwards near the right side of the design.

component.illusobjdesc: This scene takes place on the mountain of Purgatory, which rises through the right side of the design.

A stone path edges the mountain, ascending diagonally from the lower right corner of the design before it curves right around the side of the mountain. The path runs along a ledge that becomes a steep cliff on the left side.
A dark choppy sea is visible to the left of the mountain.
Wash above the horizon line and to the left of the mountain suggests a dark sky, perhaps heavy with clouds, especially nearer the right edge of the design.

Dante and Virgil stand near each other on the ledge. Dante is left of Virgil. He faces right and tilts his head back to look at the designs in the cliff to the right. His right arm is by his side but bent up at the elbow. His raised right hand is open, with vertical palm facing away from the viewer. He wears a long gown and has long curly hair.

Dante and Virgil stand near each other on the ledge. Virgil is right of Dante. His body faces away but he turns his head left. His left arm is down by his side. His right arm is by his side but bent up at the elbow. His raised right hand seems to be open with the vertical palm facing away. He wears a gown and seems to have long hair.
A white marble block carved out of the mountain rises like a cliff face on the right side of the ledge. Relief sculptures show two self-contained scenes carved into the face of the block.

A white marble block carved out of the mountain rises like a cliff face on the right side of the ledge. Relief sculptures show two self-contained scenes carved into the perpendicular face of the block. The scene on the right presents the Annunciation. The angel Gabriel hovers or flies at the left side of the scene, facing right and down. He bends forward at the waist and turns his head towards the viewer slightly. His eyes seem to be closed and his mouth may be open. His bent right arm is raised at about 45 degrees. His left arm is raised at slightly less than 45 degrees. Both raised hands are open with vertical palms facing forward. His legs are bent and both feet seem to be pointed. He wears a long transparent gown and has curly hair. At least his right wing is bent and raised behind his back. Flames burn around his upper body.

A white marble block carved out of the mountain rises like a cliff face on the right side of the ledge. Relief sculptures show two self-contained scenes carved into the perpendicular face of the block. The scene on the right presents the Annunciation. Mary sits at the right side of the scene, at a desk. She faces forward and right, and turns her head to the left to look at the angel, so that her face is visible in three-quarters profile. Her head is bent back and her eyes seem to be raised. Her mouth may be open. Her right leg is down and bent backwards, while her left leg is bent forward and drawn up slightly, resting against the desk. Her left foot may be on tiptoe. Her right arm is down and bent, with her lower arm raised across her body; her right hand is raised and she holds a quill pen in this hand. Her left arm is also down by her side and bent forward. She has long curly hair and wears a transparent gown, the folds of which are most visible around her lower body.

Relief sculptures in the white marble block at the right side of the ledge show two self-contained scenes. The scene on the right presents the Annunciation. Mary sits at the right side of the scene, at a desk. She holds a quill pen in her raised right hand.

Relief sculptures in the white marble block at the right side of the ledge show two self-contained scenes. The scene on the right presents the Annunciation. Mary sits at the right side of the scene, before a small desk or table.

Relief sculptures in the white marble block at the right side of the ledge show two self-contained scenes. The scene on the right presents the Annunciation. Mary sits at the right side of the scene, before a small desk. An open book rests on the desk.

A white marble block carved out of the mountain rises like a cliff face on the right side of the ledge. Relief sculptures show two self-contained scenes carved into the perpendicular face of the block. The scene on the left presents the Recovery of the Ark of the Covenant. The ark itself sits in an ox-cart near the center of the scene.

Relief sculptures in the white marble block at the right side of the ledge show two self-contained scenes. The scene on the left presents the Recovery of the Ark of the Covenant. The ark sits in a two-wheeled ox cart near the center of the scene.

Relief sculptures in the white marble block at the right side of the ledge show two self-contained scenes. The scene on the left presents the Recovery of the Ark of the Covenant. Two oxen in harness draw the cart that bears the ark. Both oxen face left and away, and are seen mostly from behind. The animal on the left bends its right front leg.

Relief sculptures in the white marble block at the right side of the ledge show two self-contained scenes. The scene on the left presents the Recovery of the Ark of the Covenant. The ark sits in an ox cart near the center of the scene. Two angels hover over the ark, reminiscent of carvings said to surmount the ark's lid. The angel on the right faces left and slightly away, with his or her legs extended behind to the right. Her feet may be on tiptoe. The angel's left arm is bent up at the elbow in front of her torso, with hand raised and perhaps touching her face. Her head may be bent down. She wears a long gown and her hair seems to be drawn back into a bun. Her wings are drawn up behind her back. Beams of light emanate from her raised wings.

Relief sculptures in the white marble block at the right side of the ledge show two self-contained scenes. The scene on the left presents the Recovery of the Ark of the Covenant. The ark sits in an ox cart near the center of the scene. Two angels hover over the ark, reminiscent of carvings said to surmount the ark's lid. The lower body of the angel on the left seems to face forward or right, with her legs extended backward, but she seems to twist her upper body to face left and up. Her left arm is down but bent up across her torso at the elbow and her left hand is raised. She may bend her head back. She wears a long gown, and may have a bun. Her folded wings are raised overhead, and emit beams of light.

Relief sculptures in the white marble block at the right side of the ledge show two self-contained scenes. The scene on the left presents the Recovery of the Ark of the Covenant. King David dances before the oxen that draw the cart bearing the ark. He is visible at the left side of the scene, facing left and away. He is stretched to his full height, bending backwards with both arms raised overhead, between 135 degrees and the vertical. He holds one side of a harp in his upraised right hand. His left hand is open with the palm facing up and away. His left leg is extended behind him with his foot pointed. His right leg seems to be forward slightly. His head may be bent back. He wears a semi-transparent gown that swirls with his movement.

Relief sculptures in the white marble block at the right side of the ledge show two self-contained scenes. The scene on the left presents the Recovery of the Ark of the Covenant. King David dances at the left side of the scene. He holds one side of a harp in his upraised right hand.

Relief sculptures in the white marble block at the right side of the ledge show two self-contained scenes. The scene on the left presents the Recovery of the Ark of the Covenant. King David dances at the left side of the scene. A small window appears between David's upraised arms.

Relief sculptures in the white marble block at the right side of the ledge show two self-contained scenes. The scene on the left presents the Recovery of the Ark of the Covenant. King David dances at the left side of the scene. A small window appears between David's upraised arms. Michal, wife of David, looks out of the window. She is visible from above the waist. Her torso faces right and her lower right arm seems to rest on the sill. She turns her head left and bends it down to look at David, below and to the left. She seems to have long curly hair.

Relief sculptures in the white marble block at the right side of the ledge show two self-contained scenes. The scene on the left presents the Recovery of the Ark of the Covenant. A small crowd has gathered to watch the procession of King David and the ark. At least four figures representing the crowd are visible as heads and torsos above the oxen that draw the cart bearing the ark. They face forward and left, and may be wearing gowns. Additional figures who seem to have been sketched and erased are faintly visible in two additional groups, one above the penciled crowd and the other beneath King David's upraised right arm. The text suggests that they sing, but Blake's drawing does not convey their features.

Relief sculptures in the white marble block at the right side of the ledge show two self-contained scenes. The scene on the left presents the Recovery of the Ark of the Covenant. Uzzah, an Israelite who was punished for touching the Ark of the Covenant, is here shown in the instant of punishment. He is visible to the right of the wagon bearing the ark.
