His lower body faces left and away. He steps forward with his bent left leg; his bent right leg is extended behind him and his right foot is on tiptoe. He bends backward sharply at the waist as jagged bolts of lightning strike him in the chest; he may be falling backward. Wavy lines above and to the left of his pelvis suggest steam rising from sizzling flesh. His head is bent back so far that his upside down face looks forward and to the right. His right arm is raised vertically with his open right hand raised, vertical palm facing forward. His left arm is slightly bent, drawn back behind him and extended down. His left hand is also open, with the vertical palm facing forward. His mouth is open, perhaps in a shout of pain. He is nude and has short curly hair.

desc.objtitle:
The Proud Under Their Enormous Loads The Proud Bearing Their Heavy Loads,
Object 84 (Butlin 812.81)

illustration.illusobjdesc: This scene takes place on the mountain of Purgatory, which rises through the left side of the design. A path leads up the side of the mountain, bending gently left. Rocky steps cut into the path are periodically visible. A barrier of rock bounds the path on the right side, and follows the gentle curve it takes. This barrier separates the path from a precipice on the right. The mountain bounds the path on the left. The distant sea is visible to the right of the mountain. Waves ripple its surface, which also reflects dappled light. Wash above the horizon line of the sea and to the right of the mountain suggests the sky. A luminous full moon, but with a crescent within it, hangs low over the water. Its outer crescent is brightest. Dante and Virgil stand or walk on the path near the bottom of the section shown in this design. Virgil is on the right, facing away but turning his head to the left towards Dante. His slightly bent right arm is raised vertically, and his raised right hand is open with the palm facing left. His left leg is extended backward with his left foot on tiptoe; the sole of his left foot is partly visible. Dante is on the left, his body facing away and slightly to the right. He bends forward at the waist in a crouching posture. His head, which is also bent back, is turned left; he may look towards a spirit who walks bent low beneath a heavy burden on the left. Dante holds his right arm out from his side, bent up at the elbow with open hand raised and palm facing out. His left foot is forward, while his right leg is bent backward and his right foot is on tiptoe. Four male spirits representing the Proud climb up the path, each figure bent low under an enormous stone that rests upon his back. The spirit nearest the lower left corner of the design faces right and away, and steps up with his right leg, which is bent forward and drawn up. His left leg is extended down to the left, and his left foot is on tiptoe. He bends forward sharply beneath his burden. His slightly bent right arm is drawn back to support the stone, which he holds with his right hand near the small of his back. His left hand may be visible above the stone, resting on and stabilizing it. The spirit second from left faces right and away, but turns his head farther to the right so that his face is seen in three-quarters profile. He may be looking at Dante, to the right. The spirit's right leg is bent and extended backwards, with his right foot on tiptoe. He bends forward sharply at the waist beneath his stone. His right arm is down and his right hand rests on the ground, perhaps to help support his weight. His left hand is visible resting on the stone on his back, to stabilize it. The spirit nearest the upper left corner is penciled lightly, so that some details are difficult to discern. He faces left and away, and seems to have his left leg bent and drawn up; he kneels on his left shin on a step near the top of the section of path displayed in the design. His right leg is extended down and off the step to the right; his right foot may be on tiptoe on a lower step. He leans forward sharply and may also bend forward beneath the heavy stone on his back. His left arm seems to be extended up to the left and may rest against a higher step. His right arm is visible below the elbow, bent behind his back over the top of the stone resting there; he stabilizes it with this hand, which rests palm down. The spirit second from top faces left and away. Like the other spirits, he carries a stone. He steps up with his right leg, which is bent forward and drawn up, resting on a step in the path. His slightly bent left leg is extended backward, and his left foot rests on tiptoe on a lower step. He bends forward beneath his burden. His left arm is bent and raised roughly vertically. His left hand may rest on a higher step or on the stone cliff face at the left side of the path.

component.illusobjdesc: This scene takes place on the mountain of Purgatory, which rises through the left side of the design.
A path leads up the side of the mountain of Purgatory at the left side of the design. It bends gently left. Rocky steps cut into the path are periodically visible.

A path leads up the steep side of the mountain of Purgatory at the left side of the design. A barrier of rock bounds the path on the right side, and follows the gentle curve it takes. This barrier separates the path from a precipice on the right.
A path leads up the steep side of the mountain of Purgatory at the left side of the design. The flat surface of the rising mountain bounds the path on the left.
The distant sea is visible to the right of the mountain. Waves ripple its surface, which also reflects dappled light.
Wash above the horizon line of the sea and to the right of the mountain suggests the sky.
A luminous full moon hangs low over the water. Its outer crescent is brightest.

Dante and Virgil stand or walk on the path near the bottom of the section shown in this design. Virgil is on the right, facing away but turning his head to the left towards Dante. Virgil's head is also bent down. His slightly bent right arm is raised vertically, and his raised right hand is open with the palm facing left. His left leg is extended backward with his left foot on tiptoe; the sole of his left foot is partly visible. He wears a long gown and has long curly hair.

Dante and Virgil stand or walk on the path near the bottom of the section shown in this design. Dante is on the left, his body facing away and slightly to the right. He bends forward at the waist in a crouching posture. His head, which is also bent back, is turned left; Dante may look towards a spirit who walks bent low beneath a heavy burden to the left. Dante holds his right arm out from his side, bent up at the elbow with open hand raised and palm facing forward. His left foot is forward, while his right leg is bent backwards and his right foot is on tiptoe. He wears a long gown and has long curly hair.

Four male spirits representing the Proud climb up the path, each figure bent low under an enormous stone that rests upon his back. The spirit nearest the lower left corner of the design faces right and away, and steps up with his right leg, which is bent forward and drawn up. His left leg is extended down to the left, and his left foot is on tiptoe. He bends forward sharply beneath his burden. His slightly bent right arm is drawn back to support the stone, which he holds with his right hand near the small of his back. His left hand may be visible above the stone, resting on and stabilizing it. He wears knee breeches. He may also wear a shirt, or his torso may be nude. He may have short hair.

Four male spirits representing the Proud climb up the path, each figure bent low under an enormous stone that rests upon his back. The spirit second from left faces right and away, but turns his head farther to the right so that his face is seen in three-quarters profile. He may be looking at Dante, who stands to the right. The spirit's left leg is bent and drawn forward slightly. His right leg is bent and extended backwards, with his right foot on tiptoe. He bends forward sharply at the waist beneath his burden. His right arm is down and his right hand rests on the ground, perhaps to help support his weight. His left hand is visible resting on the stone on his back, to stabilize it. He wears breeches and a shirt, and seems to have short curly hair.

Four male spirits representing the Proud climb up the path, each figure bent low under an enormous stone that rests upon his back. The spirit nearest the upper left corner is penciled lightly, so that some details are difficult to discern. He faces left and away, and seems to have his left leg bent and drawn up; he kneels on his left shin on a step near the top of the section of the path displayed in this design. His right leg is extended down and off the step to the right, though his right knee may rest on the step. His right foot may be on tiptoe on a lower step. He leans forward sharply and may also bend forward beneath the heavy stone on his back. His left arm seems to be extended up to the left and may rest against a higher step. His right arm is visible below the elbow, bent behind his back over the top of the stone resting there; he stabilizes it with this hand, which rests palm down. He may wear breeches and a shirt, or may be nude from the waist up. His head is not visible.

Four male spirits representing the Proud climb up the path, each figure bent low under an enormous stone that rests upon his back. The spirit second from top faces left and away. Like the other spirits, he carries a stone. He steps up with his right leg, which is bent forward and drawn up, resting on a step in the path. His slightly bent left leg is extended backwards, and his left foot rests on tiptoe on a lower step. He bends forward beneath his burden. His left arm is bent and raised roughly vertically. His left hand may rest on a higher step or on the stone cliff face at the left side of the path. He has short curly hair, and seems to wear breeches and a shirt.

lg.l: P-g Canto 10 This ink inscription is written over a faint (and perhaps slightly erased) inscription in pencil that is now illegible. At least part of the pencil inscription may simply be the under-writing of the ink inscription.

desc.objtitle:
The Angel Descending at the Close of the Circle of the Proud The Proud of History on the Path and the Angel Descending,
Object 85 (Butlin 812.82)

illustration.illusobjdesc: This scene takes place on the mountain of Purgatory, which fills much of the left side of the design. A sloping ledge forms a path cut into the mountain. The ledge slopes upward from the lower left corner of the design and then, midway up the design, turns left around the side of the mountain. The ledge drops into a cliff on the right side of the path. The distant sea, dappled with reflected light and rippled with waves, is visible above and to the right of the ledge. Wash above the horizon line and above and to the right of the mountain suggests the sky, perhaps with clouds. Beams of light cross the sky from a point near its center. They emanate from the sun, which is partially eclipsed behind an angel depicted near the top of the design. Dante and Virgil stand or walk together in the lower left corner of the design, on the path. Dante stands on the right, facing right and away. His right leg is bent slightly and extended backwards, and his right foot is on tiptoe. His right arm is down but bent up at the elbow, and his right hand is raised. Virgil stands on the left. His lower body faces away, but he bends backward at the waist and twists his shoulders slightly to the right, towards Dante. Virgil's right arm is by his side but bent up at the elbow, and his right hand lies on Dante's left shoulder. His left arm is raised vertically. His left leg is extended behind him, and his left foot is on tiptoe with the sole visible. An angel strides forward at the top of the section of path visible in this design, the toes of his left foot just touching the surface of the ledge. He faces forward and right. His left leg is bent forward and his left foot is on tiptoe. His legs are spread wide and his bent right leg is extended behind him. Bending forward at the waist, he tilts his head back slightly to look before him. His arms are raised and extended at 135 degrees on either side of his body, and his wings are spread wide just behind them. The angel's body crosses in front of the sun, so that its rays surround him and may appear to emanate from his wings. Relief sculpture displaying many different figures covers the surface of the ledge. One of these figures, a male who may be Nimrod, is shown with his body lying stretched on a tower (of Babel?) made of brick at the right edge of the path. The body of a snake is coiled around him, pinning him to the tower. Flames and ash may be visible above his head. The three heads of Lucifer are visible upside down at the bottom of the design. The central head, which is bearded and wears a crown, looks forward with mouth open. The heads to the right and left look right and left respectively. Lucifer's chest is visible above the heads. Flames extend past either side of the central head. A spiral coil in the body of a snake appears above Lucifer's leftmost head, next to his chest. The body of the snake extends upward and is soon hidden by other figures. Its undulating tail appears again extending up past Nimrod's head and shoulders, on the left. Its head may be faintly visible facing down with open mouth just to the left of Lucifer's leftmost head. A male dressed as a king is visible sitting with his knees drawn up near the top of the section of ledge shown in this design. He wears a crown and has a beard and long curly hair. To the right appears the head and torso of a woman dressed as a queen. She faces forward, but bends her head and turns it left. She wears a small crown and has long curly hair. To the right of this female, a mass of sketched lines suggests additional undefined, indistinct figures. A carved rope runs along the left edge of the path, at the base of the wall cut into the mountain, and then curves to the right to extend over the heads of the crowned male and his female companion. A fist, unattached to any of the other figures, seems to grip the rope over the female's head. A crowd of heads is visible to the right of Dante and Virgil. Four fists, which likely belong to members of the crowd, are raised above these clustered heads. Each fist brandishes a sword.

component.illusobjdesc: This scene takes place on the mountain of Purgatory, which fills much of the left side of the design.

A sloping ledge forms a path cut into the mountain, so that the side of the mountain rises like a wall on the left. The ledge slopes upward from the lower left corner of the design and then, midway up the design, turns left around the side of the mountain.
A sloping ledge forms a path cut into the mountain, so that the side of the mountain rises like a steep wall on the left.
A sloping ledge forms a path cut into the mountain. The ledge drops into a cliff on the right side of the path.
The distant sea, dappled with reflected light and rippled with waves, is visible above and to the right of the ledge.
Wash above the horizon line and above and to the right of the mountain suggests the sky, perhaps with clouds.
Beams of light cross the sky from a point near its center. They emanate from the sun, which is partly eclipsed behind the body of an angel depicted near the top of the design.

Dante and Virgil stand or walk together in the lower left corner of the design, on the path. Dante stands on the right, facing right and away. His right leg is bent slightly and extended backwards, and his right foot is on tiptoe. His right arm is down but bent up at the elbow, and his right hand is raised with open palm up and out. He bends his head but may raise his eyes. He wears a long gown and has long curly hair.

Dante and Virgil stand or walk together in the lower left corner of the design, on the path. Virgil stands on the left. His lower body faces away, but he bends backward at the waist and twists his shoulders slightly to the right, towards Dante. Virgil's right arm is by his side but bent up at the elbow, and his right hand lies on Dante's left shoulder. His left arm is raised vertically. His left leg is extended behind him, and his left foot is on tiptoe with the sole visible. He wears a long gown and has long curly hair.

An angel strides forward at the top of the section of path visible in this design, the toes of his left foot just touching the surface of the ledge. He faces forward and right. His left leg is bent forward and his left foot is on tiptoe. His legs are spread wide and his bent right leg is extended behind him. Bending forward at the waist, he tilts his head back slightly to look before him. His arms are raised and extended at 135 degrees on either side of his body, and his wings are spread wide just behind them. Both hands are open with the palms facing down. The semi-transparent gown he wears swirls around his legs. His long curly hair seems to fly behind his head. The angel's body crosses in front of the sun, so that its rays surround him and may appear to emanate from his wings.

Relief sculpture displaying many different figures covers the surface of the ledge. One of these figures, a male, is shown with his body lying stretched along the outer edge of the path. This figure may be Nimrod. He lies on a kind of pillar or tower made of brick. He faces forward and up, with his head pointed towards the upper right corner of the design and his legs stretched together diagonally down to the left. His arms are difficult to discern, but may be crossed over his chest. His head is turned slightly to the right. He may be nude, and seems to have visible genitals. The body of a snake is wrapped around Nimrod, pinning him to the tower. Flames and ash may be visible above his head.

Relief sculpture displaying many different figures covers the surface of the ledge. One of these figures is Nimrod, who lies stretched along the outer edge of the path on a kind of pillar or tower (of Babel?) made of brick.

Relief sculpture displaying many different figures covers the surface of the ledge. One of these figures is Nimrod, who lies stretched on a brick pillar along the outer edge of the path. The body of a serpent is coiled repeatedly around Nimrod, pinning him to the pillar. The serpent's head is visible below Nimrod's feet.

Relief sculpture displaying many different figures covers the surface of the ledge. One of these figures is Nimrod, who lies stretched on a brick pillar along the outer edge of the path. Flames and pieces of flying ash are visible above his head.

Relief sculpture displaying many different figures covers the surface of the ledge. One of these figures is Lucifer, whose three heads are visible upside down at the bottom of the design. The central head looks forward with mouth open. This head has a beard and wears a crown. The heads to the right and left of this central head look right and left respectively. The head on the left may also have an open mouth. The head on the right may raise its eyes. Irregular lines to the left and right of the central head's beard may be long hair or beards of the side heads. Lucifer's chest is visible above the heads.

Relief sculpture displaying many different figures covers the surface of the ledge. One of these figures is Lucifer, whose three heads are visible upside down at the bottom of the design. Flames extend past either side of the central head.

Relief sculpture displaying many different figures covers the surface of the ledge. One of these figures is Lucifer, whose three heads are visible upside down at the bottom of the design. A spiral coil in the body of a snake appears above his leftmost head, next to his chest. The body of the snake extends upward and is soon hidden by other figures. Its undulating tail appears again extending up past Nimrod's head and shoulders, on the left. Its head may be faintly visible facing down with open mouth just to the left of Lucifer's leftmost head.

Relief sculpture displaying many different figures covers the surface of the ledge. One of these figures is a male dressed as a king. He is visible on the left near the top of the section of ledge displayed in this design. He sits facing forward with his knees drawn up to his chest. His right arm may be visible to the left of his right knee, bent up and resting against his leg. Both of his hands seem to rest on his thighs near the kneecaps. This figure is dressed in a gown and wears a crown on his head. He has a beard and long curly hair.

Relief sculpture displaying many different figures covers the surface of the ledge. A bearded male wearing a crown is on the left near the top of the section of ledge displayed in this design. To the right appears the head and torso of a woman dressed as a queen. She faces forward, but bends her head and turns it left. Her right arm is down by her side, but may be bent up at the elbow and raised across her torso. She wears a small crown on her head, and has long curly hair.

Relief sculpture displaying many different figures covers the surface of the ledge. A king and his female companion are visible facing forward side-by-side near the top of the section of ledge displayed in this design. To the right of the queen, a mass of sketched lines suggests additional undefined, indistinct figures.

Relief sculpture displaying many different figures covers the surface of the ledge. A carving of a rope is part of this design. It runs along the left edge of the path, at the base of the wall cut into the mountain, and then curves to the right to extend over the heads of the king and his female companion.

Relief sculpture displaying many different figures covers the surface of the ledge. A carving of a rope runs along the left edge of the path, and then curves to the right to extend over the heads of the king and his female companion. A fist, unattached to any of the other figures, seems to grip the rope over the head of the king's female companion.

Relief sculpture displaying many different figures covers the surface of the ledge. A crowd of heads is visible to the right of Dante and Virgil. The head to the right of Dante's head looks forward with mouth open and forehead furrowed. Tufts of hair appear at his temples. To the right, three faces in an uneven row face forward and right with mouths open and eyes raised. Irregular lines above each face suggest curly hair. Teeth are faintly visible in the mouth of the leftmost of these three faces, and perhaps in the mouths of the other two as well. To the right of these three faces, the eyes and nose of a fifth face appear looking forward and right. This face is hidden below the nose by a sixth face looking in the same direction, with mouth open. A seventh face, with its mouth wide, looks forward and right above the fifth. The indistinct features of an eighth face are visible above and to the right of the seventh. A ninth face is visible below the first face, also looking forward. Dante's raised right hand partly hides the mouth and chin of this ninth face. A tenth face, to the right, looks forward and right with eyes raised and mouth slightly open. A eleventh and twelfth face look forward and left to the left of the first. Only the eyes of the twelfth face, farthest left, are clearly visible. Other sketched lines around this cluster of faces suggest additional indistinct heads. Another face is visible looking forward with mouth open to the left of Virgil's torso. Sketched lines above and below suggest additional indistinct faces here, near the edge of the design. Four fists, each brandishing a sword, are raised above the clustered heads.

Relief sculpture displaying many different figures covers the surface of the ledge. A crowd of heads is visible to the right of Dante and Virgil. Four fists, which likely belong to members of the crowd, are raised above these clustered heads. Each fist brandishes a sword.

l.note: The line is written on a diagonal rising from bottom to top

lg.l: Pg Canto 12 The inscription is extremely faint; it may have been partly erased. Our reading of the words before the number is conjectural.

desc.objtitle:
The Terrace of Envious Souls The Souls of the Envious,
Object 86 (Butlin 812.83)

objnote.p: Inscribed on the verso, "59" and "Pg Canto 1" top right. These inscriptions are not by Blake.

illustration.illusobjdesc: This scene, executed only as a rough pencil sketch, takes place on the mountain of Purgatory, which fills much of the right side of the design. A ledge forms a path cut into the mountain. It slopes up from the lower right corner of the design before curving right around the edge of the mountain. The ledge drops into a cliff on the left side of the path. A crevice or fissure in the mountain begins just above the path, near where it curves rightward, and rises diagonally up to meet the right edge of the design near the top right corner. The distant sea is visible to the left of the mountain. Small waves ripple its surface. Thin clouds wind through the sky above the horizon line. Penciled lines indicate beams of light crossing the sky from the upper right edge of the design. Dante and Virgil stand together on the path, near where it curves around the mountain. Penciled indistinctly, they are impossible to tell apart. Both face forward and right, and bend their heads. A group of sinners representing the Envious stand huddled close to each other on the ledge, against the foot of the rising mountain. Sketched in pencil, they are difficult to distinguish from one another and their features are impossible to discern. Some or all may lean against the rock. Several more may be seated together just to the right of this group. Like the first group, they are sketched in pencil and their numbers and individual features are impossible to distinguish from each other. All of the Envious may be blind, as in the text. One of their number has moved closer to Virgil and Dante. This may be Sapia of Siena, who speaks to Dante in the text. She flies or hovers with her torso facing away and her legs extended behind her and down to the right. Her arms are down but bent up at the elbow and held out from her sides. Several more quite indistinct figures appear in the crevice. These figures may be singing, as the text suggests, or may be ascending to another ledge higher up the mountain.

component.illusobjdesc: This scene takes place on the mountain of Purgatory, which fills much of the right side of the design.
A ledge forms a path cut into the mountain. It slopes up from the lower right corner of the design before curving right around the edge of the mountain.
A sloping ledge forms a path cut into the mountain. The ledge drops into a cliff on the left side of the path.
A crevice or fissure in the mountain begins just above the path, near where it curves rightward, and rises diagonally up to meet the right edge of the design near the top right corner.
The distant sea is visible to the left of the mountain. Small waves ripple its surface.
Thin clouds wind through the sky above the horizon line.
Penciled lines indicate beams of light crossing the sky from the upper right edge of the design.

Dante and Virgil stand together on the path, near where it curves around the mountain. Penciled indistinctly, they are impossible to tell apart. Both face forward and right, and bend their heads. They seem to wear gowns.

A group of sinners representing the Envious stand huddled close to each other on the ledge, against the foot of the rising mountain. Sketched in pencil, they are difficult to distinguish from one another and their features are impossible to discern. Some or all may lean against the rock. They seem to wear gowns. They may be blind, as in the text.

A group of figures representing the Envious stand huddled close to each other on the ledge, against the foot of the rising mountain. Several more may be seated just to the right of this group. Sketched in pencil, their numbers and individual features are impossible to distinguish from each other. They may lean against the rock. They may wear gowns, and may be blind as in the text.

A group of figures representing the Envious stand huddled close to each other on the ledge, against the foot of the rising mountain. One of their number has moved closer to Virgil and Dante, who stand on the ledge nearer its precipitous edge. This may be Sapia of Siena, who speaks to Dante in the text. She flies or hovers with her torso facing away and her legs extended behind her and down to the right. Her arms are down but bent up at the elbow and held out from her sides. Her raised hands may be open. She wears a long gown that floats to the right. She may have long hair.

A crevice or fissure in the mountain begins just above the path, near where it curves rightward, and rises diagonally up to meet the right edge of the design near the top right corner. Several quite indistinct figures appear in the crevice. Two figures whose limbs are difficult to distinguish from one another are visible near the right edge of the design. A second cluster of figures appears nearer the base of the crevice. These figures may singing, as the text suggests, or may be ascending to another ledge higher up the mountain.

lg.l: Souls This faint inscription appears above and to the right of the heads of the two left-most figures. Our reading is conjectural.

desc.objtitle:
The Angel Inviting Dante to Enter the Fire The Angel Invites Dante to Enter the Flames,
Object 87 (Butlin 812.84)

objnote.p: The lower left corner of the design bears part of the collection stamp of the National Gallery of Victoria. Inscribed on the verso, "40" top right, and "Pg Canto 27" along the right margin. These inscriptions are not by Blake.

illustration.illusobjdesc: This scene takes place on the mountain of Purgatory, which rises through the left side of the design. A series of stone steps forming a staircase has been cut into the side of the mountain. It rises from the lower left corner of the design and curves gently leftward around the edge of the mountain. Tall flames engulf the stone staircase where it curves leftward out of sight; they rise above the mountainside towards the top edge of the design. The fire here extends down over the outside edge of the staircase as well. Additional flames burn along the inner edge of the staircase nearer the lower left corner of the design. The sea is visible to the right of the mountain. Waves ripple its surface, which also reflects light from above. Wash above the horizon line suggests the sky at sunset. A thin semi-circular sliver of the setting sun is visible just above the horizon line. It sends out thin beams of light across the sky. An angel hovers before the flames at the top of the section of stairs visible in this design. He faces forward. His right arm is raised at 135 degrees; his right hand may be open with palm up. His slightly bent left arm is raised vertically. The palm of his left hand may face forward. The angel's left leg is bent and extended backwards. His large wings are folded behind him, and his long curly hair flies around his face. Dante climbs the stairs in the lower left corner of the design between Virgil, on the right, and the Roman poet Statius, on the left. Dante faces away and raises both bent arms vertically, clasping his hands above his head. His bent right leg is forward, with the foot resting on a higher step. His left leg is bent and extended backwards, and his left toes touch a lower step. He seems to crouch, and may bend his head back to look at the flames above. Virgil climbs the stairs above and to the right of Dante, his body facing away and slightly right. His slightly bent right leg is extended behind him, and his right toes rest lightly on a lower step. His left foot, which is planted on a higher step, is just visible beneath his right knee. He bends backward and left slightly, and turns and bends his head to look left and back towards Dante. His left arm is extended and drawn back towards his companion, with the hand open and palm facing out. His right arm is raised vertically; his right hand is open with the palm vertical. The spirit of Statius follows Dante and Virgil up the steep set of stairs. He climbs to the left of Dante. He faces away, but bends his head back and turns it to the right so that his face is visible in partial profile looking up. His bent left leg is extended behind him and his left foot is on tiptoe. His right leg seems to be bent forward. He raises his left arm vertically overhead, with hand open and palm up and out. His right arm is down by his side and bent at the elbow.

component.illusobjdesc: This scene takes place on the mountain of Purgatory, which rises through the left side of the design.
A series of stone steps forming a staircase has been cut into the side of the mountain. It rises from the lower left corner of the design and curves gently leftward around the edge of the mountain.

Tall flames engulf the stone staircase where it curves leftward out of sight; they rise above the mountainside towards the top edge of the design. The fire here extends down over the outside edge of the staircase as well. Additional flames burn along the inner edge of the staircase nearer the lower left corner of the design.
The sea is visible to the right of the mountain. Waves ripple its surface, which also reflects light from above.
Wash above the horizon line suggests the sky at sunset.
A thin semi-circular sliver of the setting sun is visible just above the horizon line. It sends out thin beams of light across the sky.

An angel hovers before the flames at the top of the section of stairs visible in this design. He faces forward. His right arm is raised at 135 degrees; his right hand may be open with palm up. His slightly bent left arm is raised vertically. The palm of his left hand may face forward. The angel's left leg is bent and extended backwards. His large wings are folded behind him, and his long curly hair flies around his face. He wears a transparent gown.

Dante climbs the stairs in the lower left corner of the design between Virgil, on the right, and a Roman poet named Statius, on the left. He faces away and raises both bent arms vertically, clasping his hands above his head. His bent right leg is forward, with the foot resting on a higher step. His left leg is bent and extended backwards, and his left toes touch a lower step. He seems to crouch, and may bend his head back to look at the flames above. He wears a long semi-transparent gown and has long curly hair.

Virgil climbs the stairs above and to the right of Dante, his body facing away and slightly right. His slightly bent right leg is extended behind him, and his right toes rest lightly on a lower step. His left foot, which is planted on a higher step, is just visible beneath his right knee. He bends backward and left slightly, and turns and bends his head to look left and back towards Dante. His left arm is extended and drawn back towards his companion, with the hand open and palm facing out. His right arm is raised vertically; his right hand is open with the palm vertical. He wears a semi-transparent gown that sweeps behind him, and has long curly hair spilling over his shoulders.

The spirit of the Roman poet Statius follows Dante and Virgil up the steep set of stairs. He climbs to the left of Dante. He faces away, but bends his head back and turns it to the right so that his face is visible in partial profile looking up. His bent left leg is extended behind him and his left foot is on tiptoe. His right leg seems to be bent forward. He raises his left arm vertically overhead, with hand open and palm up and out. His right arm is down by his side and bent at the elbow. He has short curly hair and wears a long semi-transparent gown.

lg.l: P-g Canto 27 Parts of this ink inscription are offset a little above and to the left of its pencil under-writing.

desc.objtitle:
Dante at the Moment of Entering the Fire Dante at the Point of Entering the Flames,
Object 88 (Butlin 812.85)

objnote.p: Inscribed on the verso, "20" top right, "N 51 next at p 27" top center, the latter partly erased in the center of the sheet, and "Hell Canto 28" along the right margin. These inscriptions are not by Blake.

illustration.illusobjdesc: This scene takes place on the mountain of Purgatory, which fills most of the design and extends beyond the right edge. The distant sea is just visible between the left edge of the design and the edge of the mountain. Waves ripple the surface of the water. Wash above and to the left of the mountain suggests the sky, which is lighter nearer the upper right corner of the design and darkens as it approaches the left edge. A ledge forming a path slopes upward from the lower right corner of the design to the left side of the mountain. It drops into a cliff on the near side of the path. Grass covers the surface of this ledge. At least half a dozen lightly intertwined vines bearing scattered leaves on their branches grow from the edge of the path down over the vertical face of the cliff. Several ferns grow from the edge of the path near the lower right corner of the design. Other leaves growing here may belong to additional indeterminate vegetation. Enormous flames rise from the ledge and stretch almost to the top edge of the design. The tops of other flames are visible above the highest visible surface of the mountain, in the upper right corner of the design. A tree grows up the right edge of the design, above the heads of the figures who stand on the ledge below. The tree's branches are visible between its leaves. Dante stands or walks on the ledge near the right edge of the design. His lower body faces forward and left, but he twists farther forward at the waist and bends rightward slightly. His left leg is forward. His head is bent and turned slightly left. Both of his arms are bent and raised roughly vertically; he clasps his hands together above his head. His mouth is open. The Roman poet Statius stands or walks on the ledge next to the right edge of the design, to the right of Dante. He faces left and away, and is seen mostly from behind. His head may be slightly lowered. His left leg is extended behind him; his left foot is on tiptoe. His upper left arm is down and drawn forward, perhaps across his chest. Virgil, to the left of Dante, has already entered the flames. He walks on his tiptoes with his left leg extended behind him. His lower body faces left, but he twists away and to the right at the waist so that his torso is seen from behind. He bends backward as well. He turns his head farther right to look behind him at Dante. His slightly bent right arm is drawn back and extended at 45 degrees, towards Dante, with the palm facing out. He holds his left arm up at 135 degrees, with the lower arm bent to the vertical. His raised left hand is open with the vertical palm facing out. His mouth may be open and his eyes seem to be raised. An angel is visible in the flames above Virgil. She flies or hovers facing forward, though her lower body may twist leftward slightly. She bends right at the waist, lowering and turning her head rightward a bit, perhaps to look at Dante below and to the right. Her arms are down by her side, bent slightly out from her body at the elbows; her open hands face out in a welcoming gesture. Her bent left leg is forward, while her right leg is hidden. Her long curly hair seems to float around her head. Her wings are folded behind her back. Four female spirits wearing transparent gowns hover in the flames to the left of Dante. Their positions suggest that they are dancing. The rightmost spirit faces forward in a contrapposto position, with her shoulders twisted slightly right and her hips and lower body twisted slightly left. She bends to the right slightly, and her hips curve left. Her left leg is bent forward, while her right is extended behind her with her right foot pointed. Her slightly bent arms are raised over her head with the right arm crossing the midline of her body. Her long curly hair falls behind her back, floating rightward to the right of her hips. The lower body of the spirit second from right faces left, but she twists her torso forward at the waist and turns her head slightly farther to the right so that her face is seen in three-quarters profile. She bends backward slightly at the waist. Her right leg is crossed behind her left at the ankle, and both feet are pointed. She raises both slightly bent arms vertically overhead. Shorter pieces of her long curly hair stand on end, while longer locks float to the right behind her back. The lower body of the spirit second from left faces forward, but she twists her torso left and bends backward at the waist. Her head is bent back but turned to look forward. Both arms, slightly bent, reach vertically overhead. Her left leg is bent and extended behind her. Both feet may be on tiptoe. Long curly hair falls down her back. The leftmost spirit faces away, bending her torso to the right and curving her hips slightly to the left. Her body takes a contrapposto position, with her hips facing slightly left and her shoulders facing slightly right. She raises her arms above her head to the right, with her hands clasped together. Her right leg is bent forward, while her left leg may be extended backward slightly. Both feet are pointed. Her hair lies between her shoulders.

component.illusobjdesc: This scene takes place on the mountain of Purgatory, which fills most of the design and extends beyond the right edge.
The distant sea is just visible between the left edge of the design and the edge of the mountain. Waves ripple the surface of the water.
Wash above and to the left of the mountain suggests the sky, which is lighter nearer the upper right corner of the design and darkens as it approaches the left edge.
A ledge forming a path slopes upward from the lower right corner of the design to the left side of the mountain.
Grass covers the surface of the ledge sloping up the side of the mountain from the lower right corner of the design.
A sloping ledge forms a path cut into the mountain. The ledge drops into a cliff on the near side of the path.

A sloping ledge forms a path cut into the mountain, dropping into a cliff on the near side of the path. At least half a dozen lightly intertwined vines bearing scattered leaves on their branches grow from the edge of the path down over the vertical face of the cliff. The vines nearest the left side of the mountain may be ivy, as may be the vine second from right. Several ferns grow from the edge of the path near the lower right corner of the design. Other leaves growing here may belong to additional indeterminate vegetation.

Enormous flames rise from the ledge and stretch almost to the top edge of the design. The tops of other flames are visible above the highest visible surface of the mountain, in the upper right corner of the design.
A tree grows up the right edge of the design, above the heads of the figures who stand on the ledge below. The tree's branches are visible between its leaves.

Dante stands or walks on the ledge near the right edge of the design, the second figure from the right. His lower body faces forward and left, but he twists farther forward at the waist and bends rightward slightly. His left leg is forward. His head is bent and turned slightly left. Both of his arms are bent and raised roughly vertically; he clasps his hands together above his head. He has long curly hair and wears a semi-transparent gown. His mouth is open.

The Roman poet Statius stands or walks on the ledge next to the right edge of the design, to the right of Dante. He faces left and away, and is seen mostly from behind. His head may be slightly lowered. His left leg is extended behind him; his left foot is on tiptoe. His upper left arm is down and drawn forward, perhaps across his chest. He wears a long gown and has long hair.

Virgil, to the left of Dante and the third figure from the right, has already entered the flames. He walks on his tiptoes with his left leg extended behind him. His lower body faces left, but he twists away and to the right at the waist so that his torso is seen from behind. He bends backwards as well. He turns his head farther right to look behind him at Dante. His slightly bent right arm is drawn back and extended at 45 degrees, towards Dante, with the palm facing out. He holds his left arm up at 135 degrees, with the lower arm bent to the vertical. His raised left hand is open with the vertical palm facing out. Virgil wears a long semi-transparent gown and has long curly hair. His mouth may be open slightly and his eyes seem to be raised.

An angel is visible in the flames above Virgil. She flies or hovers facing forward, though her lower body may twist leftward slightly. She bends right at the waist, lowering and turning her head rightward a bit, perhaps to look at Dante below and to the right. Her arms are down by her side, bent slightly out from her body at the elbows; her open hands face out in a welcoming gesture. Her bent left leg is forward, while her right leg is hidden. A transparent gown extends past her feet. Her long curly hair seems to float around her head. Her wings, folded behind her back, merge with the fire.

Four female spirits hover in the flames to the left of Dante. Their positions suggest that they are dancing. The rightmost spirit faces forward in a contrapposto position, with her shoulders twisted slightly right and her hips and lower body twisted slightly left. She bends to the right slightly, and her hips curve left. Her left leg is bent forward, while her right is extended behind her with her right foot pointed. Her slightly bent arms are raised over her head with the right arm crossing the midline of her body. Both of her hands are open, with the palms facing up and out. She turns her head slightly to the left. Her long curly hair falls behind her back, floating rightward to the right of her hips. Though a long gown extends beyond her feet, its transparency reveals her figure clearly.

Four female spirits hover in the flames to the left of Dante. Their positions suggest that they are dancing. The lower body of the spirit second from right faces left, but she twists her torso forward at the waist and turns her head slightly farther to the right so that her face is seen in three-quarters profile. She bends backward slightly at the waist. Her right leg is crossed behind her left at the ankle, and both feet are pointed. She raises both slightly bent arms vertically overhead. Her hands are open with palms facing out and up. Shorter pieces of her long curly hair stand on end, while longer locks float to the right behind her back. She wears a long transparent gown through which her figure is clearly visible.

Four female spirits hover in the flames to the left of Dante. Their positions suggest that they are dancing. The lower body of the spirit second from left faces forward, but she twists her torso left and bends backward at the waist. Her head is bent back but turned to look forward. Both arms, slightly bent, reach vertically overhead. Her hands are open with palms vertical; one palm faces forward and the other away. Her left leg is bent and extended behind her. Both feet may be on tiptoe. Her mouth may be open. Long curly hair falls down behind her back. Her figure is clearly visible through her long transparent gown.

Four female spirits hover in the flames to the left of Dante. Their positions suggest that they are dancing. The leftmost spirit faces away, bending her torso to the right and curving her hips slightly to the left. Her body takes a contrapposto position, with her hips facing slightly left and her shoulders facing slightly right. She raises her arms above her head to the right, with her hands clasped together. Her right leg is bent forward, while her left leg may be extended backward slightly. Both feet are pointed. Her hair lies between her shoulders. She wears a long transparent gown through which her figure is clearly visible.

desc.objtitle:
Dante and Statius Sleeping with Virgil Watching Dante and Statius Sleep While Virgil Watches,
Object 89 (Butlin 812.86)

illustration.illusobjdesc: This scene takes place on the mountain of Purgatory, which rises through the left side of the design. A series of stone steps forming a staircase begins near the lower left corner of the design and curls gently leftward around the mountain as it rises. A low stone wall bounds the staircase on the right side. The mountain drops into a cliff on the other side of the wall. A low bar or ridge of rock, part of the mountain, bounds the stairs on the left. A thickly leaved vine grows along the top of the wall on the right, its foliage overflowing onto the stairs midway down. Small leafy almost vine-like plants grow up between the ridge on the left and the stairs. Near the lower left corner of the design, two small patches of grass grow on the ridge between this foliage and the left edge of the design. A small tree or tree-like bush grows on top of the ridge near where it ends, just to the left of the stairs as they curve around the side of the mountain. A flowering palm or similar plant, with three leaves and two blooms, grows at the base of the tree. Small leafy plants, like those growing at the left of the stairs, also grow on either side of the tree. A patch of grass or even smaller plants grows near the left edge of the design, below and to the left of the tree. Grass covers the right side of the mountain in the upper left corner of the design. The sea is visible between the side of the mountain and the right edge of the design. Waves ripple its surface. Wash above the horizon line of the sea and to the right of the mountain suggests the nighttime sky. Four stars and a large and luminous moon hang in the sky. The moon sends beams of light in all directions. Statius lies sleeping on his side on the steps, facing away. His legs rest on the step second from lowest; he bends left at the waist to raise his torso, and props his upper body against the next highest step. His bent arms are raised and lie horizontally along the higher step. His head is lowered. His left leg is bent backwards so that the bottom of his left sole faces out. Dante sleeps lying on his side on a step above Statius. He faces forward with his left leg hidden behind his right, which is extended along the step to the right. His right upper arm lies along the step and his right lower arm is bent up around his head, with his hand resting palm down over his temple. His head is turned down slightly, and his eyes are closed. Virgil lies on his side one step above Dante. He faces forward and bends right at the waist to raise his torso. His weight is propped on his bent left arm, which is down; his left forearm lies along the step. His right arm, slightly bent, rests along his side. His legs extend together to the left: the right may be slightly behind the left. His head is turned slightly left and his eyes are raised. He is the only one of the three poets who is awake. A tableau depicting Rachel and Leah appears within the moon above. Rachel sits on the upper left, facing right and gazing into a standing mirror. Long hair cascades down her back. Her right arm is down and bent, with the elbow resting on her lap and the lower arm raised. She makes a pointing gesture with the index finger of her raised right hand. A lock of her long hair may drape over her far shoulder and run through her loose fingers. Alternatively she may be combing her hair. The backrest and one rear leg of her chair are visible; its right front leg is hidden beneath Rachel's skirts. The mirror or cheval glass into which she gazes stands to the right of her chair. It faces forward and left, reflecting Rachel's figure from the waist up. Leah sits on the lower right, facing forward, beneath the Tree of Error and Mystery. Her right leg is bent and drawn up, while her bent left leg rests on the ground. Her arms seem to be down, and her left arm may rest on her lap. Her head is bent. The leafy branches of the Tree of Error and Mystery are visible above her head and to the right.

component.illusobjdesc: This scene takes place on the mountain of Purgatory, which rises through the left side of the design.
A series of stone steps forming a staircase begins near the lower left corner of the design and curls gently leftward around the mountain as it rises.

A series of stone steps forming a staircase begins near the lower left corner of the design and curves gently leftward around the mountain as it rises. A low stone wall bounds the staircase on the right side. The mountain drops into a cliff on the other side of the wall.

A series of stone steps forming a staircase begins near the lower left corner of the design and curves gently leftward around the mountain as it rises. A low bar or ridge of rock, part of the mountain, bounds the stairs on the left.

A series of stone steps forming a staircase begins near the lower left corner of the design and curves gently leftward around the mountain as it rises. A low stone wall bounds the staircase on the right side. A thickly leaved vine grows along the top of the wall, its foliage overflowing onto the stairs midway down. In addition to leaves, the vine also bears berries.

A series of stone steps forming a staircase begins near the lower left corner of the design. A low bar or ridge of rock, part of the mountain, bounds the stairs on the left. Small leafy almost vine-like plants grow up between the ridge on the left and the stairs. Berries grow between the leaves near the midpoint of the foliage. A few more berries may be visible partly hidden beneath the leaves near where the ridge ends and the stairs curve around the side of the mountain.

A series of stone steps forming a staircase begins near the lower left corner of the design. A low bar or ridge of rock, part of the mountain, bounds the stairs on the left; thick foliage grows on or next to the stairs just to the right of the rock ridge. Near the lower left corner of the design, two small patches of grass grow on the ridge between this foliage and the left edge of the design.

A series of stone steps forming a staircase begins near the lower left corner of the design. A low bar or ridge of rock, part of the mountain, bounds the stairs on the left. A small tree or tree-like bush grows on top of the ridge near where it ends, just to the left of the stairs as they curve around the side of the mountain. The tree's branches are visible through its leaves.

A series of stone steps forming a staircase begins near the lower left corner of the design. A low bar or ridge of rock, part of the mountain, bounds the stairs on the left. A small tree or tree-like bush grows on top of the ridge near where it ends, just to the left of the stairs as they curve around the side of the mountain. A flowering palm or similar plant grows at the base of this tree. The palm sends up three leaves and two blooms.

A series of stone steps forming a staircase begins near the lower left corner of the design. A low bar or ridge of rock, part of the mountain, bounds the stairs to the left. A small tree or tree-like bush grows on top of the ridge near where it ends, just to the left of the stairs as they curve around the side of the mountain. Small leafy plants, like those growing at the left of the stairs, also grow on either side of the tree. A patch of grass or even smaller plants grows near the left edge of the design, below and to the left of the tree.
This scene takes place on the mountain of Purgatory, which rises through the left side of the design. Grass covers the right side of the mountain in the upper left corner of the design.
The sea is visible between the side of the mountain and the right edge of the design. Waves ripple its surface.
Wash above the horizon line of the sea and to the right of the mountain suggests the nighttime sky.
Four stars glimmer in the nighttime sky, above the sea.
A large and luminous moon hangs in the sky above the waters of the sea. It sends beams of light in all directions.

Statius lies sleeping on his side on the steps, facing away. His legs rest on the step second from lowest; he bends left at the waist to raise his torso, and props his upper body against the next highest step. His arms are raised and lie horizontally along the higher step. They are bent in towards his torso at the elbow. His head is lowered and may rest on his arms or the step. His left leg is bent backwards so that the bottom of his left sole faces out. His right leg is not visible below the knee. He wears a long transparent gown. His long curly hair falls down his back and over his right shoulder.

Dante sleeps lying on his side on a step above Statius. He faces forward with his left leg hidden behind his right, which is extended along the step to the right. His left arm is hidden. His right upper arm lies along the step and his right lower arm is bent up around his head, with his hand resting palm down over his temple. His head is turned down slightly, and his eyes are closed. He wears a long semi-transparent gown. A few locks of curly hair are visible beneath his left hand and beside his left forearm.

Virgil lies on his side one step above Dante. He faces forward and bends right at the waist to raise his torso. His weight is propped on his bent left arm, which is down; his left forearm lies along the step. His right arm, slightly bent, rests along his side. His legs extend together to the left: the right may be slightly behind the left. His head is turned slightly left and his eyes are raised. He wears a long semi-transparent gown. His long curly hair spills falls past his shoulders. He is the only one of the three poets who is awake.

A tableau depicting Rachel and Leah appears within the moon. Rachel sits on the upper left, facing right and gazing into a standing mirror. Long hair cascades down her back. Her right arm is down and bent, with the elbow resting on her lap and the lower arm raised. She makes a pointing gesture with the index finger of her raised right hand. A lock of her long hair may drape over her far shoulder and run through her loose fingers. Alternatively she may be combing her hair. Her legs are bent.

A tableau depicting Rachel and Leah appears within the moon. Rachel sits on the upper left in a straight-backed chair. Its backrest and one rear leg are visible; its right front leg is hidden beneath Rachel's skirts.

A tableau depicting Rachel and Leah appears within the moon. Rachel sits on the upper left, facing right and gazing into a standing mirror or cheval glass to the right of her chair. The mirror faces forward and left, reflecting Rachel's figure from the waist up.

A tableau depicting Rachel and Leah appears within the moon. Leah sits on the lower right, facing forward, beneath the Tree of Error and Mystery. Her right leg is bent and drawn up, while her bent left leg rests on the ground. Her arms seem to be down, and her left arm may rest on her lap. Her head is bent and she may have long hair. She seems to wear a gown. Other features are difficult to discern in her pencil outline.

A tableau depicting Rachel and Leah appears within the moon. Leah sits on the lower right, facing forward, beneath the Tree of Error and Mystery. Its leafy branches are visible above her head and to the right.

lg.l:
Leah and
Lines 1-2 are written in the upper-right quadrant of the circle (the moon) in the sky upper right. These lines are extremely faint and partly drawn over; our reading is conjectural.

Dante
Lines 3-4 are written in the lower half of the circle (the moon) in the sky upper right.

Dream
The word is extremely faint and drawn over; our reading is conjectural. Butlin 812.86 reads lines 3-4 as "dante['s dream?]."

desc.objtitle:
Beatrice on the Car with Matilda and Dante Dante and Matilda on the Banks of the River Lethe,
Object 90 (Butlin 812.87)

illustration.illusobjdesc: This scene shows heaven on the far bank of the river Lethe, which undulates across the design from the lower left corner to the middle of the right edge. Thick grass and flowers carpet the banks of the river on both sides. The flowers may be anemones. Two tall trees are rooted in the lower right corner of the design. Their trunks grow up the right side of the design, and their leafy branches fill the upper right corner. The branches of the leftmost tree arch more than halfway across the upper edge of the design. Another tall tree grows from the edge of the far bank, very near the left edge of the design. Several of its leafy branches arch rightward across the top of the design. Together with the trees on the right, these branches form a kind of frame for the scene. Dante stands alone on the near side of the river, facing left and away. His face is visible in partial profile from behind, looking left. His arms are down by his side but bent up at the elbow so that his lower arms are raised before him with the open hands facing away from his body. Virgil and Statius stand together between the trunks of the trees that are rooted in the lower right corner of the design. Both face left and away. Virgil stands on the left and seems to bend backwards slightly. Statius stands on the right, bending his left arm and open left hand up in front of his chest. Matilda stands on the far bank of the river, to the left of Dante. She faces forward, turning her head slightly right. Her slightly bent right arm is down by her side, while her left arm is bent up at the elbow and her left hand is raised. A large candelabrum hovers on the far bank of the river Lethe at the left side of the design. Its central stem is carved to resemble a palm tree trunk. Six branches supporting large multicolored flames emerge from this central stem, which rises to become a slender branch with a seventh flame. All seven flames are reflected on the surface of the river below. Multicolored light streams rightward from the flames on the candelabrum, forming a horizontal rainbow. The other figures in the procession are visible through the transparent colored light. A carved angel wearing a long gown rests on each branch of the candelabrum. The angel on the central stem faces forward with wings spread on either side of his or her body. The angels on the side branches mirror their horizontal counterparts, facing forward and out from the central stem. One end of a long cloud supports the candelabrum that hovers on the far bank of the river Lethe at the left side of the design. The cloud winds along the ground beside Lethe as the river curves towards the right edge of the design. It follows the path of the river most closely in the rightmost third of the design. Angels stand on either side of the candelabrum that hovers on the far bank of the river Lethe at the left side of the design. Their feet rest on a segment of the cloud that supports the candelabrum. The angel on the left faces forward and slightly left, and turns his head to the right slightly. His right arm is down by his side; a large closed book is tucked under and supported by his right forearm. His left arm is down but bent up and out at the elbow. The angel on the right faces forward and slightly right. His right arm is down but bent up and out at the elbow. His left arm is down by his side, and he holds a large closed book against his side with his left lower arm. A large chariot, cart, or wagon forms part of a procession of figures winding leftward across the design on the far bank of the river. The chariot has a flat platform where Beatrice stands. A spiral of fire forms the chariot's left wheel. Flames extend diagonally up to the right from the wheel. Four large wings rise from the corners of the chariot and meet overhead. Spots on the wings represent eyes. A gryphon pulls the chariot. The large creature is visible at the left of the chariot, facing left. Its large wings are raised high above its back. A thin, transparent cloud begins above the wings of the gryphon, rises up to pass the top of the large wings that form part of the chariot, and trails away over the heads of the figures near the end of the procession. Scattered flower petals rain down from before this cloud, to the left of the gryphon's upraised wings. Beatrice stands facing forward and left on the flat platform of the chariot. She leans back slightly, with her right arm extended down by her side. Her left arm is down but bent up and forward at the elbow. A cloak drapes over her head and falls to the platform. She may be holding the edge of the cloak with her right hand. A group of elders files between the candelabrum at the left of the design and the chariot near the center of the design. They are bunched in a group, and most of them are not delineated distinctly. The four that are most clearly visible walk in file facing forward and left. They wear long gowns and all seem to have long hair and long beards. The tops of multiple heads are visible above these men, suggesting the presence of many more elders in the group. Four women dance while holding hands in a circle in front of the fiery wheel of the chariot. The leftmost figure faces forward with her right arm down by her side and her left arm extended horizontally to the right. The rightmost figure faces left and extends her arms horizontally in front of her. One of the women positioned in the center of the ring mostly obscures a second. The woman in the front faces away but may turn her head to the left so that her face is seen in profile. She extends her arms horizontally on either side of her body. The other woman in the center of the ring, who is mostly hidden, seems to face forward but turns her head to the left. Her right arm is down by her side but bent up, while her left arm may be raised horizontally or may be extended out from her body to the right at 45 degrees. Seven male figures walking in single file follow the chariot. The two leftmost of these are old men who walk near one another. The rightmost of this pair supports a sword, scepter, or rod against his left arm and shoulder. Four more men of the group of seven walk in a bunch slightly separate from the older pair. The first and fourth of these seem to hold swords, rods, or scepters, while the second and fourth carry bags or sacks on their backs. The seventh and final figure is visible through the trunks of the trees on the right side of the design, walking alone. He seems to bend his head downward and fold his arms across his chest.

component.illusobjdesc: This scene shows heaven on the far bank of the river Lethe, which undulates across the design from the lower left corner to the middle of the right edge.

Thick grass and flowers carpet the banks of the river on both sides. The flowers may be anemones. A fern or similar vegetation grows at the very edge of the river on both sides near the lower left corner.

Two tall trees are rooted in the lower right corner of the design. Their trunks grow up the right side of the design, and their leafy branches fill the upper right corner. The branches of the leftmost tree arch more than halfway across the upper edge of the design, helping to frame the scene below.

Another tall tree grows from the edge of the far bank, very near the left edge of the design. Several of its leafy branches arch rightward across the top of the design. Together with the trees on the right, these branches form a kind of frame for the scene.

Dante stands alone on the near side of the river, facing left and away. His face is visible in partial profile from behind, looking left. He tilts his head back slightly to look at Matilda across the stream. His arms are down by his side but bent up at the elbow so that his lower arms are raised before him. Both raised hands are open, with the vertical palms facing away from his body. His left leg is bent backwards and his left foot is on tiptoe. He wears a long gown and has long curly hair.

Virgil and Statius stand together between the trunks of the trees that are rooted in the lower right corner of the design. Virgil stands on the left, facing left and away. He seems to bend backward slightly. Both arms are visible only from shoulder to elbow; they are down by his sides and at least the left seems to be drawn forward slightly. Virgil wears a long gown and has long curly hair.

Virgil and Statius stand together between the trunks of the trees that are rooted in the lower right corner of the design. Statius stands on the right, facing left and away. He may bend backward slightly. His left arm is down but bent up in front of his chest at the elbow. His raised left hand is open, with the vertical palm facing out.

Matilda stands on the far bank of the river, to the left of Dante. She faces forward, turning her head slightly to the right to look at Dante. Her mouth may be open. Her slightly bent right arm is down by her side. Her left arm is down but bent up at the elbow. Her raised left hand is open with the vertical palm facing forward. The shape of the long gown she wears suggests that she may stand in a contrapposto position with her weight resting on her left leg. She has long curly hair.

A large candelabrum hovers on the far bank of the river Lethe, at the left side of the design. Its central stem is carved to resemble a palm tree trunk. Six branches supporting large multicolored flames emerge from this central stem, which rises to become a slender branch with a seventh flame. A carved angel rests on each branch.

A large candelabrum hovers on the far bank of the river Lethe, at the left side of the design. Six branches supporting large multicolored flames emerge from this central stem, which rises to become a slender branch with a seventh flame. All seven flames are reflected on the surface of the river below. The lower branches of the candelabrum appear to have a fringe, possibly of leaves.

A large candelabrum hovers on the far bank of the river Lethe, at the left side of the design. Six branches supporting large multicolored flames emerge from this central stem, which rises to become a slender branch with a seventh flame. Multicolored light streams rightward from the flames across the design, forming a horizontal rainbow. The other figures in the procession are visible through the transparent colored light.

A large candelabrum with six side branches and a central stem hovers on the far bank of the river Lethe, at the left side of the design. A carved angel wearing a long gown rests on each branch. The angel on the central stem faces forward with wings spread on either side of his or her body. The angels on the side branches mirror their horizontal counterparts. The angels of the topmost pair each face forward and out from the central stem, bending backward at the waist and turning their heads inward towards the central stem. They raise their arms horizontally out from the central stem, as if holding the flame on their branch aloft. Their wings are folded and raised behind their backs. They seem to have long hair. The angels in the second and third pair face forward and out. They bend backward at the waist and their legs extend behind them. Their wings are folded behind their backs. They may raise their arms and may have long hair. Because these figures are sketched lightly, their finer features are difficult to discern.

One end of a long cloud supports the candelabrum that hovers on the far bank of the river Lethe at the left side of the design. The cloud winds along the ground beside Lethe as the river curves towards the right edge of the design. It follows the path of the river most closely in the rightmost third of the design.

Angels stand on either side of the candelabrum that hovers on the far bank of the river Lethe at the left side of the design. Their feet rest on a segment of the cloud that supports the candelabrum. The angel on the left faces forward and slightly left, and turns his head to the right slightly, perhaps to look at Matilda and Dante. The angel's right arm is down by his side; a large closed book is tucked under and supported by his right forearm. His left arm is down but bent up and out at the elbow. The angel's mouth is open. He wears a long gown and has long hair. No wings are visible.

Angels stand on either side of the candelabrum that hovers on the far bank of the river Lethe at the left side of the design. Their feet rest on a segment of the cloud that also supports the candelabrum. The angel on the right faces forward and slightly right, and seems to be looking at Matilda and Dante. His right arm is down but bent up and out at the elbow. His left arm is down by his side, and he holds a large closed book against his side with his left lower arm. His mouth is open. He wears a long gown and has long hair. No wings are visible.

A large chariot, cart, or wagon forms part of a procession of figures winding leftward across the design on the far bank of the river. The chariot has a flat platform where Beatrice stands. A spiral of fire forms the chariot's left wheel. Flames extend diagonally up to the right from the wheel. Four large wings rise from the corners of the chariot and meet overhead. Spots on the wings represent eyes.

A large chariot forms part of a procession of figures winding leftward across the design on the far bank of the river. A gryphon pulls the chariot. The large creature stands at the left of the chariot, facing left. It has the head, the beak, and the taloned front left foot of an eagle, and the furred body of a lion. Its large wings are raised high above its back.

A large chariot forms part of a procession of figures winding leftward across the design on the far bank of the river. Beatrice stands facing forward and left on the flat platform of the chariot. She turns her head farther left so that her face is seen in profile. She stands leaning back slightly, with her right arm extended down by her side. Her left arm is down but bent up and forward at the elbow. She has long hair and wears a gown. A cloak over her head falls to the platform. She may be holding the edge of the cloak with her right hand. There may be an alternative sketch of Beatrice just to the right of the more finished figure.

A group of elders files between the candelabrum at the left of the design and the chariot near the center of the design. They are bunched in a group, and most of them are not delineated distinctly. The four that are more clearly visible walk in file facing forward and left. They wear long gowns and all seem to have long hair and long beards. The tops of multiple heads are visible above these men, suggesting the presence of many more elders in the group.

A large chariot forms part of a procession of figures winding leftward across the design on the far bank of the river. Four women dance while holding hands in a circle in front of the fiery wheel of the chariot. The leftmost figure faces forward with her right arm down by her side and her left arm extended horizontally to the right; she may hold hands with one or both of the two figures to the right. She stands in contrapposto position with her weight on her right foot and her left leg bent forward at the knee. Her right hip is curved out and she may bend to the right at the waist slightly. She wears a long gown and has long hair.

A large chariot forms part of a procession of figures winding leftward across the design on the far bank of the river. Four women dance while holding hands in a ring in front of the fiery wheel of the chariot. The rightmost figure faces left and extends her arms horizontally in front of her. The shape of the long gown she wears suggests that one leg may be bent backward slightly at the knee. She may have long hair.

A large chariot forms part of a procession of figures winding leftward across the design on the far bank of the river. Four women dance while holding hands in a ring in front of the fiery wheel of the chariot. One of the women positioned in the center of the ring mostly obscures a second. The woman in the front faces away but may turn her head to the left so that her face is seen in profile. She extends her arms horizontally on either side of her body. She wears a long gown, the shape of which suggests that her right leg is extended behind her.

A large chariot forms part of a procession of figures winding leftward across the design on the far bank of the river. Four women dance while holding hands in a ring in front of the fiery wheel of the chariot. One of the women positioned in the center of the ring mostly obscures a second, who seems to face forward but turns her head to the left. Her right arm is down by her side but bent up, and she may hold the hand of a woman to the left with her raised right hand. Her left arm may be raised horizontally, or may be extended out from her body to the right at 45 degrees. This woman wears a long gown.

A large chariot drawn by a gryphon forms part of a procession of figures winding leftward across the design on the far bank of the river. A thin, transparent cloud begins above the wings of the gryphon, rises up to pass the top of the large wings that form part of the chariot, and trails away over the heads of the figures near the end of the procession.

A large chariot drawn by a gryphon forms part of a procession of figures winding leftward across the design on the far bank of the river. A thin, transparent cloud begins above the wings of the gryphon, which rise high above the creature's back. Scattered flower petals rain down from before this cloud, to the left of the gryphon's upraised wings.

A large chariot drawn by a gryphon forms part of a procession of figures winding leftward across the design on the far bank of the river. Seven male figures walking in single file follow the chariot. The leftmost of these is an old man who faces forward and slightly left. His left arm may be down by his side. He has long curly hair and a curly beard. He wears a gown. His mouth may be open.

A large chariot drawn by a gryphon forms part of a procession of figures winding leftward across the design on the far bank of the river. Seven male figures walking in single file follow the chariot. Second to left walks an old man who faces left and slightly forward. The shape of the long gown he wears suggests that one of his legs is bent backwards at the knee. His left arm is down but drawn forward slightly, and he supports a sword, scepter, or rod with this arm. The shaft of the weapon rests against his left shoulder. Over his gown he wears a cloak that hangs down behind his back.

A large chariot drawn by a gryphon forms part of a procession of figures winding leftward across the design on the far bank of the river. Seven male figures walking in single file follow the chariot. Two old men walk near one another nearest the chariot. Four more men walk facing leftward in a bunch behind the old men. All four wear gowns and seem to have short hair. The leftmost of this group may hold his left arm down and forward slightly. The blade of a sword, scepter, or rod seems to rise behind his back.

A large chariot drawn by a gryphon forms part of a procession of figures winding leftward across the design on the far bank of the river. Seven male figures walking in single file follow the chariot. Two old men walk near one another nearest the chariot. Four more men walk facing leftward in a bunch behind the old men. All four wear gowns and seem to have short hair.
