The man second to left may carry a sack or bag behind his back. His left arm may be down by his side.

A large chariot drawn by a gryphon forms part of a procession of figures winding leftward across the design on the far bank of the river. Seven male figures walking in single file follow the chariot. Two old men walk near one another nearest the chariot. Four more men walk facing leftward in a bunch behind the old men. All four wear gowns and seem to have short hair. The man third from left is drawn even more faintly than the rest, but may hold his arm down by his side.

A large chariot drawn by a gryphon forms part of a procession of figures winding leftward across the design on the far bank of the river. Seven male figures walking in single file follow the chariot. Two old men walk near one another nearest the chariot. Four more men walk facing leftward in a bunch behind the old men. All four wear gowns and seem to have short hair. The man at the back of this group seems to carry a bag or sack behind his back. The point of a sword, rod, or scepter points upward above his head. His left arm may be down by his side.

A large chariot drawn by a gryphon forms part of a procession of figures winding leftward across the design on the far bank of the river. Seven male figures walking in single file follow the chariot. The rightmost of these is visible through the trunks of the trees on the right side of the design, walking alone. He faces forward and left, and seems to bend his head downward and fold his arms across his chest. He wears a long gown and may have long hair.

desc.objtitle:
Beatrice Addressing Dante from the Car Beatrice Addresses Dante from the Car,
Object 91 (Butlin 812.88)

objnote.p: Inscribed on the verso, "24" and "Pg Canto 29" bottom right. These inscriptions are not by Blake.

illustration.illusobjdesc: This scene takes place on the banks of the river Lethe, though the river itself is not visible. The ground at the bottom of the design is flat and carpeted with grass and blossoms. Bands of colored light cross the sky horizontally the width of the design, forming a kind of rainbow. A thin ribbon of cloud begins near the upper left corner, curving gently across the top of the design until it meets the band of cloud surrounding the halo of the gryphon that stands at the right. Several other fainter ribbons of cloud are visible above the first. A chariot fills the left side of the design. Its right wheel is a vortex of flames, in which swirling figures and disembodied eyes appear. Beasts with enormous upraised wings stand at each of the four corners of the chariot. Large eyes are scattered over each of the beasts' wings. The beasts' heads, each with a halo, are visible between their upraised wings. The head of the creature farthest left is an eagle's, the head of the creature second to left is a lion's, the head of the creature third from left is a man's, and the head of the creature farthest right is a bull's. Beatrice stands facing forward on the chariot's platform. Her weight is shifted to her left leg, and her left hip curves out to the right. Her right leg is bent at the knee, and her right foot may be on tiptoe. Her slightly bent right arm is down by her side with the palm of her open hand facing forward and her fingers spread. Her left arm is down but bent up at the elbow; her upraised left hand is open with the palm facing forward and the fingers spread. She wears a transparent gown through which her figure is plainly visible. A cloak drapes over her head and shoulders and falls to her feet, where it puddles on the platform. Her long curly hair hangs down her back almost to her knees. She wears a crown on her head. Her head emits light like a halo. A gryphon pulls the chariot; this creature is visible at the right of the chariot, facing right. Its feathered wings are raised high above its back. Beams of light stream from its head. A thin cloud makes a semi-circle around the creature's head, forming a kind of halo with the light. Dante's text portrays three women dancing near the right wheel of the chariot. One of these women stands or dances next to the left edge of the design. She faces forward, but twists at the waist so that her torso is turned slightly left and her lower body is turned slightly right. Both of her arms are raised vertically overhead. Her hands are open and she makes a pointing gesture with the index fingers of both hands. Both feet are on tiptoe. She wears a long semi-transparent gown that eddies around her legs. To the right, a second woman stands or walks facing forward and right. Her head is bent but her eyes are raised. Her right arm is down by her side and drawn back slightly. Her left arm is down but bent up at the elbow; she holds her raised left hand open with the vertical palm facing forward. She wears a long semi-transparent gown, which reveals that her left leg is bent and extended backward with the left foot on tiptoe. A headband with jewels, beading, or similar adornment circles her head. Five nude infants hover around her lower body, facing forward. Three are visible to the right of her legs, and two to the left. A third woman stands or walks to the right of the wheel. Her weight rests on her left foot, while her slightly bent right leg is extended behind her and her right foot is on tiptoe. Her lower body faces right but she twists away at the waist so that her torso is seen from behind; she turns her head even further and tilts it back to look left and up. Her right arm is raised horizontally to the right. Her left arm is raised at 45 degrees, and she rests the tip of her left index finger on the page of a book that lies open on a cloud to the left. She wears a transparent gown that swirls around her leg. Dante stands or walks in the lower right corner of the design, facing left and forward. He lowers his head but raises his eyes to look up at Beatrice, above him to the left. His left arm is down by his side but bent forward at the elbow. Both of his hands are raised in front of his chest; they are open with fingers spread and vertical palms facing in towards each other. The shape of the long gown he wears indicates that his left leg is bent backwards at the knee.

component.illusobjdesc: This scene takes place on the banks of the river Lethe, though the river itself is not visible. The ground at the bottom of the design is flat.
This scene takes place on the banks of the river Lethe, though the river itself is not visible. The flat ground across the bottom of the design is carpeted with grass and blossoms.
Bands of colored light cross the sky horizontally the width of the design, forming a kind of rainbow.

A thin ribbon of cloud begins near the upper left corner, curving gently across the top of the design until it meets the band of cloud surrounding the halo of the gryphon that stands at the right. Several other fainter ribbons of cloud are visible above the first.

A chariot fills the left side of the design. Its right wheel is a vortex of flames, in which swirling figures and disembodied eyes appear. The flat platform above has a decorative edge, which is just visible above and to the right of the wheel, featuring engraved lotus blossoms. A beast with enormous upraised wings stands at each of the four corners of the chariot.

A chariot fills the left side of the design. A beast with enormous upraised wings stands at each of the four corners of the design. Large eyes are scattered over each of the beasts' wings. Halos encircle their heads, which appear between their wings. The creature at the right rear corner of the chariot appears farthest left in the design, and has the head of an eagle with a strong sharp beak. Besides its wings, only its head and one shoulder are visible. It looks right and bends its head slightly. Laurels wreath its head. It has short curly hair, or perhaps feathers that suggest the effect of hair. A shadow surrounds the edges of its halo.

A chariot fills the left side of the design. A beast with enormous upraised wings stands at each of the four corners of the design. Large eyes are scattered over each of the beasts' wings. Halos encircle their heads, which appear between their wings. The creature at the left rear corner of the chariot appears second to left in the design, and has the head of a lion. Besides its wings, only its head is visible. Its head faces forward and slightly left, its eyes also turned slightly left as if looking at the eagle to the left. It has a long curly mane that extends up from its forehead and down below its chin. This mane also suggests long hair and a long beard. His halo is so transparent that it becomes difficult to see above and to the right of his head. A shadow appears above and to the left of the halo.

A chariot fills the left side of the design. A beast with enormous upraised wings stands at each of the four corners of the design. Large eyes are scattered over each of the beasts' wings. Halos encircle their heads, which appear between their wings. The creature at the left front corner of the chariot appears farthest right in the design, and has the head of a bull. Besides its wings, only its head is visible, facing forward and slightly left. It has small horns on top of its head. A shadow appears around the edges of its halo.

A chariot fills the left side of the design. A beast with enormous upraised wings stands at each of the four corners of the design. Large eyes are scattered over each of the beasts' wings. Halos encircle their heads, which appear between their wings. The creature at the right front corner of the chariot appears second to right in the design, and has the head of a man. Besides its wings, only its head and part of its chest is visible. Its torso faces forward and right, but it turns its head slightly left. It may also bend its head slightly. It has a beard and long curly hair. A shadow appears around the edges of its halo.

A chariot fills the left side of the design. Its right wheel is a vortex of flames. Three figures appear in the spiral of the vortex. Their faces are distinct, while their bodies meld into the fire. The head of one figure is visible near the center of the vortex, looking forward with upraised eyes. The figure's long curly hair sweeps back from its forehead. Its body curls away to the left in the spiralling flames. A second head is visible above and to the right of the first. It faces forward but is turned slightly down; its hair blends with the fire and its body extends to the left. The third head is visible below the first, facing forward but tilted back with eyes raised. This figure's mouth seems to be open. Its long curly hair extends left as if standing on end, while its body extends right. Multiple disembodied eyes also appear in the vortex.

Beatrice stands facing forward on the chariot's platform. She turns her head to the right slightly. Her weight is shifted to her left leg, and her left hip curves out to the right. Her right leg is bent back at the knee, and her right foot may be on tiptoe. Her slightly bent right arm is down by her side with the palm of her open hand facing forward and her fingers spread. Her left arm is down but bent up at the elbow; her upraised left hand is open with the palm facing forward and the fingers spread. She wears a transparent gown through which her figure is plainly visible. A cloak drapes over her head and shoulders and falls to her feet, where it puddles on the platform. Her long curly hair hangs down her back almost to her knees. She wears a crown on her head. Her head emits light like a halo. The shape of the light around her suggests, but does not quite fully constitute, a mandorla.

A chariot fills the left side of the design. A gryphon pulls the chariot; this creature is visible at the right of the chariot, facing right. It has the head, the beak, and the scaly taloned feet of an eagle, and the thickly furred body of a lion. Its feathered wings are raised high above its back. Beams of light stream from the gryphon's head. A thin cloud makes a semi-circle around the creature's head, forming a kind of halo with the light.

A chariot fills the left side of the design. Dante's text portrays three women dancing near the right wheel of this vehicle. One of these women stands or dances next to the left edge of the design. She faces forward, but twists at the waist so that her torso is turned slightly left and her lower body is turned slightly right. Both of her arms are raised vertically overhead, though her left arm is bent slightly. Her hands are open and she makes a pointing gesture with the index fingers of both hands. Her left leg is forward slightly, while her right leg is extended backward. Both feet are on tiptoe. She wears a long semi-transparent gown that eddies around her legs. Her curly hair is drawn up into a bun, with some loose tendrils at her neck. Her mouth is open, displaying her teeth.

A chariot fills the left side of the design. Dante's text portrays three women dancing near the right wheel of this vehicle. One of these women stands or dances next to the left edge of the design. To the right, a second woman stands or walks facing forward and right. Her head is bent but her eyes are raised. Her right arm is down by her side and drawn back slightly. Her left arm is down but bent up at the elbow; she holds her raised left hand open with the vertical palm facing forward. She wears a long semi-transparent gown, which reveals that her left leg is bent and extended backward with the left foot on tiptoe. A headband with jewels, beading, or similar adornment circles her head. Short tendrils of her curly hair stand on end behind the headband, while longer locks cascade down over her shoulders and behind her back, falling nearly to the ground. Five infants hover around her lower body.

A chariot fills the left side of the design. Dante's text portrays three women dancing near the right wheel of this vehicle. The woman second from left stands or walks facing forward and right. Five nude infants hover around her lower body, facing forward. Three are visible to the right of her legs, and two to the left. The highest infant on the right holds its arms crossed in front of its torso. Its legs are bent and crossed at the calves. It has short curly hair. Its mouth may be open.

A chariot fills the left side of the design. Dante's text portrays three women dancing near the right wheel of this vehicle. The woman second from left stands or walks facing forward and right. Five nude infants hover around her lower body, facing forward. Three are visible to the right of her legs, and two to the left. The second-highest infant on the right twists its lower body slightly to the left and its upper body slightly to the right. Its right leg is bent and extended backwards. It raises its bent left arm vertically, and holds its right arm bent up across its chest. Neither hand is clearly visible. It seems to have long curly hair.

A chariot fills the left side of the design. Dante's text portrays three women dancing near the right wheel of this vehicle. The woman second from left stands or walks facing forward and right. Five nude infants hover around her lower body, facing forward. Three are visible to the right of her legs, and two to the left. The legs of the infant lowest on the right extend together down to the right, and its left leg may be bent forward slightly. Neither arm is clearly visible. The infant's mouth may be open.

A chariot fills the left side of the design. Dante's text portrays three women dancing near the right wheel of this vehicle. The woman second from left stands or walks facing forward and right. Five nude infants hover around her lower body, facing forward. Three are visible to the right of her legs, and two to the left. The infant lowest on the left tilts its head back to look up slightly. Its mouth may be open. Its lower body is twisted to the left. It may hold its right arm horizontally across its chest.

A chariot fills the left side of the design. Dante's text portrays three women dancing near the right wheel of this vehicle. The woman second from left stands or walks facing forward and right. Five nude infants hover around her lower body, facing forward. Three are visible to the right of her legs, and two to the left. The infant highest on the left turns its head slightly to the left. It has short curly hair. Its arms are difficult to discern but may be folded across its chest.

A chariot fills the left side of the design. Dante's text portrays three women dancing near the right wheel of this vehicle. Two women stand or dance near the left edge of the design. A third stands or walks to the right of the wheel. Her weight rests on her left foot, while her slightly bent right leg is extended behind her and her right foot is on tiptoe. Her lower body faces right but she twists away at the waist so that her torso is seen from behind; she turns her head even further and tilts it back to look left and up. Her right arm is raised horizontally to the right; her right hand is open with the palm facing out. Her left arm is raised at 45 degrees, and she rests the tip of her left index finger on the page of a book that lies open on a cloud to the left. She wears a transparent gown that swirls around her legs. Her curly hair is piled up into a bun at the crown of her head.

Dante's text portrays three women dancing near the right wheel of the chariot that fills the left side of this design. One stands or walks to the right of the wheel with her left arm raised at 45 degrees and the tip of her left index finger resting on the page of an open book. A puff of cloud or smoke to the left of the female figure's legs supports the book.
A puff of cloud or smoke to the right of the vortex supports a large open book.

Dante stands or walks in the lower right corner of the design, facing left and forward. He lowers his head but raises his eyes to look up at Beatrice, above him to the left. His left arm is down by his side but bent forward at the elbow. Both of his hands are raised in front of his chest; they are open with fingers spread and vertical palms facing in towards each other. As a result, his right palm faces out towards the viewer. The shape of the long gown he wears indicates that his left leg is bent backwards at the knee. He has long curly hair.

desc.objtitle:
The Harlot and the Giant,
Object 92 (Butlin 812.89)

objnote.p: Inscribed on the verso, "30" top right, and "N 36 next at p 92" top center. These inscriptions are not by Blake.

illustration.illusobjdesc: This scene takes place on the opposite bank of the river Lethe. The ground at the bottom of the design is flat and may be covered with grass. Thorny vines grow along the ground below and to the right of feet belonging to the giant who stands at the center of the design. The trunk of a large tree grows through the right side of the design. Two of its branches, bare of leaves but dangling large round fruits on stems or much smaller branches, extend diagonally up to the right through the upper right corner of the design. Another branch arches leftward from the trunk to the upper edge of the design. Round fruits attached to smaller branches hang throughout the upper left corner of the design. Wash above and around the figures suggests the sky, which is dark to the right of the tree and lighter to the left. The Great Beast of Revelation with its seven heads appears at the left side of the design. Its body takes the form of a snake standing on upright coils, supporting the Whore of Babylon above. Its long tail undulates up the left side of the design into the upper left corner. Its neck is raised to the right. The seven heads appear along its scaly neck and coils. The rightmost head is attached to the terminal end of the Beast's body, and is turned to face forward. Though this head has large human-like or simian ears, its snout suggests a dog or similar animal. It wears an elaborate papal crown surmounted with a cross. The head second from right faces right and away, and is seen partly from behind. This head has the horns and perhaps the ears of a bull. It wears a crown. The head third from right is very bovine, facing forward with eyes raised. It has horns at its temples. A line of shaggy hair or fur circles its face like a mane. Its mouth is open, revealing its teeth and tongue. It wears a crown. A fourth head is visible just above, facing left and away and seen mostly from behind. It has two horns, one above its forehead and one apparently emerging from the right side of its skull. The features of the final three heads are human. The third from left faces forward; a single horn, which also suggests a crown, sprouts from the top of its head. Second from left, a head with long hair looks left. A single horn reminiscent of a crown grows from its forehead. The wrinkles on this head's face make it appear to be old. The leftmost head is tilted back but looks forward. It has long curly hair, a beard, and a curled mustache. A single horn, much like a crown, appears above its forehead. The Whore of Babylon sits on the back of the Great Beast. Her torso, facing forward and right, is visible above its many heads. Her feet, clad in slim shoes, are visible just below the scaly neck of the Beast's rightmost head. She holds her arms out to the sides of her body at 45 degrees, bent up to 135 degrees at the elbow. She points to the right with the index finger of her raised left hand and grasps a large goblet in her upraised right hand. Frothy liquid bubbles at the rim of the goblet and drips down on either side. Her head is tilted back; she purses her lips to kiss the giant to the right. A three-tiered crown rests on her head, and she wears an earring in her right ear and two large rings on her left index finger. A male giant stands near the Whore, to the right. His lower body faces forward, but he bends left at the waist to bring his face closer to the Whore's, twisting his upper body to face slightly left as well. He kisses the Whore on the mouth. He extends his left arm out at 45 degrees, and with the fingers and thumb of this hand he holds one tasseled end of a rope tied to the rightmost head of the Beast. The giant has a beard and short curly hair, and wears a full suit of armor. Beatrice is visible to the right of the giant's legs. She kneels beneath the tree, with her legs bent and drawn up beneath her. Her body faces forward and right, but she turns her head to the left. Her arms are by her side, bent up at the elbow with open hands raised and palms facing up and out. Three women stand clustered together near the right edge of the design. The rightmost of these stands facing away, but turns her head and tilts it back so that her face is visible in profile looking up to the left. Her curly hair is piled on top of her head in a bun. Her arms are visible to the elbow, down by her side. The woman in the middle faces forward, through she turns her bent head slightly left. Her right arm is by her side but drawn forward and bent at the elbow across her chest. Her left hand is just visible to the left of the rightmost woman's hip; it supports a large closed book against the woman's upper body. She rests her right hand on the top of the book. The lower body of the woman to the left faces forward, though she bends and twists right at the waist towards the woman in the middle. Her right arm is by her side but drawn forward and bent at the elbow across her chest. Her raised right hand rests on her breast and she may hold the neckline of her gown with this hand. Her left forearm is bent up in front of her upper body and her left hand rests on or supports her cheek. She may lean against or touch the woman to the right.

component.illusobjdesc: This scene takes place on the opposite bank of the river Lethe. The ground at the bottom of the design is flat and may be covered with grass.
The grassy ground at the bottom of the design is flat. Thorny vines grow along the ground below and to the right of feet belonging to the giant who stands at the center of the design.

The trunk of a large tree grows through the right side of the design. Two of its branches, bare of leaves but dangling large round fruits on stems or much smaller branches, extend diagonally up to the right through the upper right corner of the design. Another branch arches leftward from the trunk to the upper edge of the design. Round fruits attached to smaller branches hang throughout the upper left corner of the design.
Wash above and around the figures suggests the sky, which is dark to the right of the tree and lighter to the left.

The Great Beast of Revelation with its seven heads appears at the left side of the design. Its body takes the form of a snake standing on upright coils, supporting the Whore of Babylon above. Its long tail undulates up the left side of the design into the upper left corner. Its neck is raised to the right. The seven heads appear along its scaly neck and coils. The rightmost head is attached to the terminal end of the Beast's body, and is turned to face forward. Though this head has large human-like or simian ears, its snout suggests a dog or similar animal. Its mouth is slightly open and its lips are curved in a smile. It wears an elaborate papal crown surmounted with a cross. Tassels on ropes descend from the hat on either side, behind the head's ears. The head second from right faces right and away, and is seen partly from behind. Its features (or what can be seen of them) seem to be human, but this head has the horns and perhaps the ears of a bull. It may lower its eyes. It wears a crown. The head third from right is very bovine, facing forward with eyes raised. It has horns at its temples. A line of shaggy hair or fur circles its face like a mane. Its mouth is open, revealing its teeth and tongue. It wears a crown. A fourth head is visible just above, facing left and away and seen mostly from behind. Though this head's features are difficult to discern, they seem human-like. It has two horns, one above its forehead and one apparently emerging from the right side of its skull. The features of the final three heads are human. The third from left faces forward with eyes turned to the right and head tilted back slightly. A single horn, which also suggests a crown, sprouts from the top of its head. It may have short hair. Second from left, a head with long hair looks left. A single horn reminiscent of a crown grows from its forehead. The wrinkles on this head's face make it appear to be old. The leftmost head is tilted back but looks forward. It has long curly hair, a beard, and a curled mustache. A single horn, much like a crown, appears above its forehead. All of the heads appear to be male. The Beast casts a slight shadow on the ground below and to the left.

The Whore of Babylon sits on the back of the Great Beast. Her torso, facing forward and right, is visible above its many heads. Her feet, clad in slim shoes, are visible just below the scaly neck of the Beast's rightmost head. She holds her arms out to the sides of her body at 45 degrees, bent up to 135 degrees at the elbow. She grasps a large goblet in her upraised right hand, and points to the right with the index finger of her raised left hand. Her head is tilted back; she purses her lips to kiss the giant to the right. Her eyes are lowered slightly. A three-tiered crown rests on her head, and her long curly hair cascades from beneath it down her back and over her left shoulder. She wears a large earring in the lobe of her right ear. Two rings, each with a large stone, adorn her left index finger. She wears a long gown.
The Whore of Babylon sits on the back of the Great Beast. She grasps a large goblet in her upraised right hand. Frothy liquid bubbles at its rim and drips down in a line of droplets on either side.

The Whore of Babylon sits on the back of the Great Beast. A male giant stands near her, to the right. His lower body faces forward, but he bends left at the waist to bring his face closer to the Whore's, twisting his upper body to face slightly left as well. His lowered head is seen in profile looking left. He kisses the Whore on the mouth. His right arm is hidden behind the Whore, but he extends his left arm out at 45 degrees, and with the fingers and thumb of this hand he holds one tasseled end of a rope tied to the rightmost head of the Beast. His right foot, just visible to the left of his left foot, may be on tiptoe. He has a beard and short curly hair, and wears a full suit of armor.
A male giant stands near the Whore of Babylon, who sits on the back of the Great Beast. With his left hand, the giant holds one tasseled end of a rope tied to the rightmost head of the Beast.

Beatrice is visible to the right of the giant's legs. She kneels beneath the tree, with her legs bent and drawn up beneath her. Her body faces forward and right, but she turns her head left, so that her face is seen in three-quarters profile looking left. She also tilts it back slightly. Her arms are by her side, bent up at the elbow with open hands raised and palms facing up and out. She wears a long transparent gown that reveals her figure, and has long curly hair. She may wear a crown on her head. Her mouth may be open slightly, and her eyes may be raised.

Three women stand clustered together near the right edge of the design. The rightmost of these stands facing away, but turns her head and tilts it back so that her face is visible in profile looking up to the left. Her mouth is open slightly. Her curly hair is piled on top of her head in a bun. Her arms are visible to the elbow, down by her side. The right upper arm is drawn slightly forward. She wears a long gown, one transparent enough to reveal that her right leg is bent backwards at the knee and her right foot is on tiptoe.

Three women stand clustered together near the right edge of the design. The woman in the middle faces forward, though she turns her bent head slightly left. Her mouth is open. Her right arm is by her side but drawn forward and bent at the elbow across her chest. Her left hand is just visible to the left of the rightmost woman's left hip; it supports a large closed book against the woman's upper body. She rests her right hand on the top of the book. She wears a long gown. Her curly hair is piled on top of her head in a bun. One foot may be visible beneath the hem of her gown, though it is difficult to tell which foot.

Three women stand clustered together near the right edge of the design. The lower body of the woman to the left faces forward, though she bends and twists right at the waist towards the woman in the middle. Her right arm is by her side but drawn forward and bent at the elbow across her chest. Her raised right hand rests on her breast and she may hold the neckline of her gown with this hand. Her left forearm is bent up in front of her upper body and her left hand rests on or supports her cheek. She may lean against or touch the woman to the right. She wears a semi-transparent gown through which her legs are visible. Her left leg is bent forward and her left foot is on tiptoe. Her hair is drawn up in a bun, though curly tendrils escape at her temples.

lg.l: P-g. Canto 32 The number in ink is offset a little to the left of its pencil under-writing.

desc.objtitle:
The Spiral Stairway,
Object 93 (Butlin 812.91)

illustration.illusobjdesc: This design, executed entirely in pencil, is set in Paradise. A dome at the bottom of the design suggests part of an orb, perhaps the surface of the earth. A narrow staircase spirals up from the orb to the top edge of the design, forming five loops that contract in size as they rise. Indistinct lines on either side of the staircase and below it, on the orb of the earth, suggest clouds in a sky. Four stars are visible in the sky, two on either side of the staircase. A number of tiny figures are visible near the base of the staircase where it leaves the orb. The figures in the lowest grouping stand or walk at the base of the staircase, farthest left. They are difficult to distinguish but the number of heads suggests that there may be as many as five, who may face to the right and away. To the right of this grouping, and slightly above them, a pair ascends facing right and away. The figure on the right is taller than the one on the left, who may be a child. The figure on the right steps up with right leg bent forward. This figure may bend its head; its left arm is down and drawn back slightly, holding the raised right hand of the childlike figure on the left. This childlike figure may extend one leg backwards. Above the lowest and leftmost grouping, and slightly to the right, a third group ascends together facing right and away. The number of heads suggests that there may be four figures in this group. At least three of the figures draw one extended arm back at 45 degrees, and step up in unison with bent legs. Above the pair holding hands and to the left, a single figure stands, apparently facing right. This figure may hold something unidentifiable in its right hand. Above the pair holding hands and to the right, another single figure is visible. This figure seems to face forward and slightly left, and may step down with left leg bent backwards. The figure's right arm seems to be down by its side. To the right and slightly above this figure, another single figure stands whose exact position is difficult to decipher. It may be facing away and ascending, or facing forward and descending the stairs. At the far right of the lowest curve in the staircase, a loosely sketched figure stands or walks. Below and to the left of this figure, a loose line may be intended to represent yet another single figure standing or walking on the stairs. A series of five figures are visible standing or walking along the lower curve of the lowest full spiral in the staircase. The two leftmost figures seem to face and walk to the right, and may have large wings. The three rightmost figures are sketched so loosely that details of their positions and features are impossible to discern, though all three seem to be standing.

component.illusobjdesc: This design, executed entirely in pencil, is set in Paradise. A dome at the bottom of the design suggests part of an orb, perhaps the surface of the earth.

A dome at the bottom of the design suggests part of an orb, perhaps the surface of the earth. A narrow staircase spirals up from the orb to the top edge of the design, forming five loops that contract in size as they rise.

A narrow staircase spirals up through the design from the orb at the bottom to the top edge. Indistinct lines on either side of the staircase and below it, on the orb of the earth, suggest clouds in a sky.
A narrow staircase spirals up through the design from the orb at the bottom to the top edge. Four stars are visible in the sky, two on either side of the staircase.

A narrow staircase spirals up through the design from the orb at the bottom to the top edge. A number of tiny figures are visible near the base of the staircase, where it leaves the orb. The figures in the lowest grouping stand or walk at the base of the staircase, farthest left. They are difficult to distinguish but the number of heads suggests that there may be as many as five, who may face to the right and away. They seem to wear gowns.

A narrow staircase spirals up through the design from the orb at the bottom to the top edge. A number of tiny figures are visible near the base of the staircase, near where it leaves the orb. The lowest grouping is also the farthest left. To the right of this grouping, and slightly above them, a pair ascends facing right and away. The figure on the right is taller than the one on the left, who may be a child. The figure on the right steps up with right leg bent forward. This figure may bend its head; its left arm is down and drawn back slightly, holding the raised right hand of the childlike figure on the left. This childlike figure may extend one leg backwards. Both figures wear gowns.

A narrow staircase spirals up through the design from the orb at the bottom to the top edge. A number of tiny figures are visible near the base of the staircase, where it leaves the orb. The lowest grouping is also the farthest left. Above this grouping and slightly to the right, a third group ascends together, facing right and away. The number of heads suggests that there may be four figures in this group. At least three of the figures draw one extended arm back at 45 degrees, and step up in unison with bent legs. They seem to wear gowns.

A narrow staircase spirals up through the design from the orb at the bottom to the top edge. A number of tiny figures are visible near the base of the staircase, where it leaves the orb. A few steps up from the bottom, a pair holding hands ascends facing right and away. Above this pair and to the left, a single figure stands, apparently facing right. The figure seems to wear a gown, and may hold something unidentifiable in its right hand.

A narrow staircase spirals up through the design from the orb at the bottom to the top edge. A number of tiny figures are visible near the base of the staircase, where it leaves the orb. A few steps up from the bottom, a pair holding hands ascends facing right and away. Above this pair and to the right, a single figure is visible. This figure seems to face forward and slightly left, and may step down with left leg bent backwards. The figure's right arm seems to be down by its side. It may wear a gown. Other features are impossible to discern.

A narrow staircase spirals up through the design from the orb at the bottom to the top edge. A number of tiny figures are visible near the base of the staircase, where it leaves the orb. A few steps up from the bottom, a pair holding hands ascends facing right and away. Two figures to the right stands or walks another figure whose exact position is difficult to decipher. This figure seems to wear a gown, and may be facing away and ascending, or facing forward and descending the stairs.

A narrow staircase spirals up through the design from the orb at the bottom to the top edge. A number of tiny figures are visible on the lowest curve of the staircase, near where it meets the orb. At the far right of this curve, a loosely sketched figure stands or walks. This figure seems to wear a gown, and may be facing away and ascending, or facing forward and descending the stairs.

A narrow staircase spirals up through the design from the orb at the bottom to the top edge. A number of tiny figures are visible on the lowest curve of the staircase, near where it meets the orb. At the far right of this curve, a loosely sketched figure stands or walks. Below and to the left of this figure, a loose line may be intended to represent another figure standing or walking on the stairs.

A narrow staircase spirals up through the design from the orb at the bottom to the top edge. A series of five figures are visible standing or walking along the lower curve of the lowest full spiral in the staircase. The leftmost figure seems to face to the right and walk with one leg forward. This figure seems to wear a gown and may have wings folded behind its back.

A narrow staircase spirals up through the design from the orb at the bottom to the top edge. A series of five figures are visible standing or walking along the lower curve of the lowest full spiral in the staircase. The figure second to left seems to face and walk to the right. It may wear a gown. It seems to have large wings spread to either side of its body.

A narrow staircase spirals up through the design from the orb at the bottom to the top edge. A series of five figures are visible standing or walking along the lower curve of the lowest full spiral in the staircase. The three rightmost figures are sketched so loosely that details of their positions and features are impossible to discern. All three seem to stand or walk, and to wear gowns.

lg.l: Paradiso Canto 19 The inscription is very faint and may have been partly erased. Our reading of the first word is conjectural.

desc.objtitle:
Dante Adoring Christ Dante in Adoration of Christ,
Object 94 (Butlin 812.90 recto)

objnote.p: Inscribed on the verso, "96" top left, "N 43 next at p 33 Vanni Fucci 24" and "Vanni Fucci" partly erased along the left margin, and "Canto 23 Paradiso" partly erased along the right margin. These inscriptions are not by Blake.

illustration.illusobjdesc: The figure of Christ stands facing forward with his head near the top of the design, which represents a vision Dante describes having in the Fifth Heaven. Christ's legs are together, though the right is bent back slightly at the knee; his feet rest on a fiery sun. His right foot may be on tiptoe. He extends his arms horizontally to either side of his body, holding his upraised hands out with vertical palms facing forward. This posture suggests the crucifixion. His mouth may be open slightly. He has a beard and long curly hair that spills down his back, visible beneath his arms on either side. His transparent gown seems to shimmer with movement around his legs. Clouds and flames surround Christ, from whom emits the beams of light visible below his feet, to the right of his left leg, and below his left arm. Flames blow upward from the sun beneath Christ's feet. Two more suns burn on either side of his body, one behind each of Christ's upraised hands. Each sun radiates light and flames that fill their respective corners of the design. Dante kneels at the bottom of the design, facing away. His legs are bent and drawn up beneath him with the knees spread wide; both feet are on tiptoe with the soles facing out. He leans back and to the right, and tilts his head back sharply to look up at Christ above. His arms are extended at 135 degrees and spread wide on either side of his body. His upraised hands are open with the palms facing up. He has long curly hair, and wears a semi-transparent gown. Clouds, smoke, and flame billow up from either side of Dante to merge with the sun's fire and surround the figure of Christ above.

component.illusobjdesc: The figure of Christ stands facing forward with his head near the top of the design, which represents a vision Dante describes having in the Fifth Heaven. Christ stands facing forward with his head near the top edge of the design. His legs are together, though the right is bent back slightly at the knee; his feet rest on a fiery sun. His right foot may be on tiptoe. He extends his arms horizontally to either side of his body, holding his upraised hands out with vertical palms facing forward. This posture suggests the crucifixion. His mouth may be open slightly. He has a beard and long curly hair that spills down his back, visible beneath his arms on either side. His transparent gown seems to shimmer with movement around his legs. Clouds and flames surround Christ, from whom emits the beams of light visible below his feet, to the right of his left leg, and below his left arm.

Christ stands facing forward with his head near the top of the design. His feet rest on a fiery sun. Flames blow upward from the sun on either side of his body. Two more suns burn on either side of his body, one behind each of Christ's upraised hands. Each sun radiates light and flames that fill their respective corners of the design.

Dante kneels at the bottom of the design, facing away. His legs are bent and drawn up beneath him with the knees spread wide; both feet are on tiptoe with the soles facing out. He leans back and to the right, and tilts his head back sharply to look up at Christ above. His arms are extended at 135 degrees and spread wide on either side of his body. His upraised hands are open with the palms facing up. He has long curly hair, and wears a semi-transparent gown.

Christ stands facing forward with his head near the top of the design. His feet rest on a fiery sun. Dante kneels below. Clouds, smoke, and flame billow up from either side of Dante to merge with the sun's fire and surround the figure of Christ above.

desc.objtitle:
The Recording Angel,
Object 95 (Butlin 812.92)

illustration.illusobjdesc: This scene takes place in the Sixth Heaven of Paradise, where the throne of the Recording Angel rests on the fallen world. A gently curving line near the bottom of the design represents the surface of the fallen world. The Recording Angel sits on a throne that rests on this curving surface. The angel's wings and gown obscure almost all of this seat except for its base, which extends out along the surface of the world to left and right. The Recording Angel sits facing forward. His legs are bent forward and an open scroll is draped across his lap. His left arm is down by his side and bent forward at the elbow. He holds one rolled end of the scroll loosely in his left hand. His right arm is down but bent forward, and his lower right arm rests on his thigh. He holds a quill pen loosely with his right hand; his right index finger lies lightly along its shaft in a pointing gesture. He may be writing on the scroll in his lap. The toes of his left foot peek from beneath the hem of his gown, decorated with a chevron pattern. His long beard reaches all the way to his lap, while tendrils of his long, flame-like hair stand on end. His eyes are raised and his eyebrows creased. His large feathered wings are raised and their tips touch far above his head. The outline of his wings suggests a mandorla. A star glimmers above his head, between his upraised wings. Two more stars are visible below his throne, one on either side of his feet. Wash surrounding his figure suggests the sky, with the suggestion of clouds at the left and right edges of the design near the base of the throne.

component.illusobjdesc: This scene takes place in the Sixth Heaven of Paradise, where the throne of the Recording Angel rests on the fallen world. A gently curving line near the bottom of the design represents the surface of the fallen world.

The Recording Angel sits on a throne that rests on the curving surface of the Fallen World. The angel's wings and gown obscure almost all of this seat except for its base, which extends out along the surface of the world to left and right.

The toes of his left foot peek from beneath the hem of his gown, decorated with a chevron pattern. His long beard reaches all the way to his lap, while tendrils of his long, flame-like hair stand on end. His eyes are raised and his eyebrows creased. His large feathered wings are raised and their tips touch far above his head. The outline of his wings suggests a mandorla.

The Recording Angel sits on a throne that rests on the surface of the Fallen World. Wash surrounding this figure suggests the sky, with the suggestion of clouds at the left and right edges of the design near the base of the throne.

lg.l: PARA 67 v 65 This inscription is extremely faint; our reading is conjectural.

desc.objtitle:
Dante and Beatrice in the Constellation of Gemini and the Sphere of Flame,
Object 96 (Butlin 812.93)

illustration.illusobjdesc: This scene takes place in the Eighth Heaven. Two transparent and imbricated spheres fill the design; the sphere on the right overlaps the one on the left, partially hiding it. Sketched lines around both spheres suggest that angels fly or hover at their edges. Wash around the spheres and inside them suggests the sky, lit with varying shades of light. Beatrice stands in contrapposto, facing forward, just to the right of the midpoint of the design. Her weight rests on her right leg; her left leg is bent backwards slightly and her left foot is on tiptoe. Her right hip bows out slightly. Both of her arms are down by her side but bent up and out at the elbow. Her open hands are raised with the vertical palms facing forward. She turns her head to the left, and tilts it forward and left slightly. Her eyes are raised. She wears a crown, and a long transparent gown swirls around her legs. Tendrils of her long curly hair seem to float on either side of her body. Dante stands in contrapposto, facing away, to the left of Beatrice. His weight rests on his right leg, while his left leg is bent back slightly and his left foot rests on tiptoe. The sole of his left foot is visible. He seems to bend backwards slightly at the waist. His head is turned to the right and he seems to look at Beatrice, who stands to the right. His arms are by his side but bent up and out at the elbow. His right hand is open with the palm facing out from his body. He may hold his left hand, which is not drawn clearly, in a similar position. He has long curly hair and wears a transparent gown.

component.illusobjdesc: This scene takes place in the Eighth Heaven. Two transparent, imbricated spheres fill the design; the sphere on the right overlaps the one on the left, partially hiding it.
Two transparent, overlapping spheres fill the design. Wash around the spheres and inside them suggests the sky, lit with varying shades of light.

Two transparent, overlapping spheres fill the design. Very indistinct sketched lines around both spheres suggest that angels fly or hover at their edges. The angels' figures seem to be stretched to full length, forming rings isomorphic with the edges of the spheres. They seem to wear long gowns. Other details of their features and positions are too indistinct to determine.

Beatrice stands in contrapposto, facing forward, just to the right of the midpoint of the design. Her weight rests on her right leg; her left leg is bent backwards slightly and her left foot is on tiptoe. Her right hip bows out slightly. Both of her arms are down by her side but bent up and out at the elbow. Her open hands are raised with the vertical palms facing forward. She turns her head to the left, and tilts it forward and left slightly. Her eyes are raised. She wears a crown. A long transparent gown swirls around her legs. Tendrils of her long curly hair seems to float on either side of her body.

Dante stands in contrapposto, facing away, to the left of Beatrice. His weight rests on his right leg, while his left leg is bent back slightly and his left foot rests on tiptoe. The sole of his left foot is visible. He seems to bend backwards slightly at the waist. His head is turned to the right and he seems to look at Beatrice, who stands to the right. His arms are by his side but bent up and out at the elbow. His right hand is open with the palm facing out from his body. He may hold his left hand, which is not drawn clearly, in a similar position. He has long curly hair and wears a transparent gown.

desc.objtitle:
Saint Peter Appears to Beatrice and Dante,
Object 97 (Butlin 812.94)

objnote.p: Inscribed on the verso, "99" top right. This inscription is not by Blake.

illustration.illusobjdesc: The hovering figures of St. Peter, Beatrice, and Dante fill much of the design, which represents a vision of Dante's in Paradise. Wash around the figures suggests the sky. St. Peter flies or hovers inside a flame near the top of the design. His body is roughly horizontal, with his lower body facing away and extending to the right. He may be descending. His right leg extends behind him, out toward the viewer, and may be bent at the knee; the sole of his right foot is visible. His upper body inclines diagonally down to the left. He also bends backwards sharply and bends his head back, so that his face looks forward and down. His right arm is raised at 45 degrees and bent to the right; he holds the shaft of a large key in his right hand. His left hand is visible, open with the palm facing out, below and to the right of his head. He has long curly hair and a long beard, and wears a long gown. Spiky beams of light issue from the flame, which also emits a diffuse radiance. Beatrice flies or hovers below St. Peter to the right. Her body faces left and down and extends on a diagonal with her head upper left and her feet lower right. She bends backwards at the waist slightly and tilts her head back to look up at St. Peter above, turning it forward so that her face is visible in three-quarters profile. She raises both arms at roughly 135 degrees to the left, though her right arm is slightly higher than the left, which may also be bent slightly. Her left palm faces up while her right palm faces forward and up. She appears to be reaching upward to receive the key from Peter. Her left leg, down to the right, seems to be twisted so that the knee faces forward; her left foot may be on tiptoe. A crown circles her head, over the long curly hair that extends down her back. Her long semi-transparent gown ripples down her legs, suggesting her movement, and billows past her feet. Dante flies or hovers to the left, on a diagonal with his head at upper right and his legs extending down to the left. His lower body faces down, but he twists away at the waist so that his upper body is seen from behind. He bends backward at the waist slightly and tilts his head back, turning it up so that his face is visible in profile looking up. His mouth is open and his eyes are raised. Both arms are by his sides but bent up at the elbow; he holds his forearms just to either side of his body. His raised hands are open with the vertical palms facing away from his body. He wears a long transparent gown and has long curly hair. His right foot, visible through his gown, is on tiptoe. His gestures and expression suggest surprise or awe.

component.illusobjdesc: The hovering figures of St. Peter, Beatrice, and Dante fill much of the design, which represents a vision of Dante's in Paradise. Wash around the figures suggests the sky.

St. Peter flies or hovers inside a flame near the top of the design. His body is roughly horizontal, with his lower body facing away and extending to the right. His right leg extends behind him, out toward the viewer, and may be bent at the knee; the sole of his right foot is visible. His upper body inclines diagonally down to the left. He also bends backwards sharply and bends his head back, so that his face looks forward and down. His mouth is open, displaying his teeth. With lowered eyes, he seems to be looking at Beatrice below him to the right. His right arm is raised at 45 degrees and bent to the right; he holds the shaft of a large key in his right hand. He may be descending to give the key to Beatrice. His left hand is visible, open with the palm facing out, below and to the right of his head. He has long curly hair and a long beard, and wears a long gown.

St. Peter flies or hovers inside a flame near the top of the design. His body is roughly horizontal, and the flame itself extends horizontally along the top edge of the design. Spiky beams of light issue from the flame, which also emits a diffuse radiance.

St. Peter flies or hovers inside a flame near the top of the design. Beatrice flies or hovers below him to the right. Her body faces left and down, and extends on a diagonal with her head upper left and her feet lower right. She bends backwards at the waist slightly and tilts her head back to look up at St. Peter above, turning it forward so that her face is visible in three-quarters profile. Her eyes are raised and her mouth may be open slightly. She raises both arms at roughly 135 degrees to the left, though her right arm is slightly higher than the left, which may also be bent slightly. Both upraised hands are open. Her left palm faces up while her right palm faces forward and up. She appears to be reaching upward to receive the key from Peter. Her left leg, down to the right, seems to be twisted so that the knee faces forward; her left foot may be on tiptoe. A crown circles her head, over the long curly hair that extends down her back. Her long semi-transparent gown ripples down her legs, suggesting her movement, and billows past her feet.

St. Peter flies or hovers inside a flame near the top of the design. Dante flies or hovers below him to the left, on a diagonal with his head at upper right and his legs extending down to the left. His lower body faces down, but he twists away at the waist so that his upper body is seen from behind. He bends backward at the waist slightly and tilts his head back, turning it up so that his face is visible in profile looking up. His mouth is open and his eyes are raised. Both arms are by his sides but bent up at the elbow; he holds his forearms just to either side of his body. His raised hands are open with the vertical palms facing away from his body. He wears a long transparent gown and has long curly hair. His right foot, visible through his gown, is on tiptoe. His gestures and expression suggest surprise or awe.

desc.objtitle:
Saint Peter and Saint James with Dante and Beatrice,
Object 98 (Butlin 812.95)

objnote.p: Inscribed on the verso, "105" (or possibly "103") top right. This inscription is not by Blake.

illustration.illusobjdesc: The hovering figures of St. Peter, St. James, Beatrice, and Dante fill much of this design, which represents a vision of Dante's in Paradise. Wash around the figures suggests the sky. Two of the figures, enclosed in large flames, fill much of the top half of this design. The figure on the left represents St. Peter. His body is largely horizontal, but he bends backwards slightly at the waist and lifts his head to look forward and right. He extends his bent right arm horizontally to the right, holding up the first two fingers of his raised right hand as if he bestows a blessing or benediction. His left hand is visible below his chest, open with the palm up and holding a large key against his torso. His lower body extends left and away; his right leg is bent up at the knee and the bottom of his right foot is visible. His similarly raised left foot appears below and to the right of his right foot. He has a long beard and long curly hair; he wears a long semi-transparent gown that swirls around his legs. The flame in which he appears extends up towards the upper left corner of the design. The figure in the flame on the right represents St. James. His body extends diagonally up towards the upper right corner of the design. His lower body faces forward, but he twists his upper body down very slightly. His legs are together and seem to be slightly bent; his right foot hides his left. His left arm is by his side, bent up with the hand positioned in front of his torso and perhaps resting on his beard. His right arm is bent upward and slightly raised. His right hand, extended towards St. Peter on the left, is open with the palm facing forward and up. St. James' head is tilted back slightly and he looks forward and to the left. He has long curly hair and a long beard as well, and he wears a long semi-transparent gown. Spiky beams of light issue from both flames, which also emit a diffuse radiance. Small tongues of fire are visible between the beams. Beneath the figures of the saints, Dante flies or hovers near the bottom edge of the design. His lower body faces down and slightly away, but he twists and bends backward and right at the waist so that his upper body faces away and is seen from behind. He extends his arms to either side; the right arm is raised horizontally, while the left is raised at 135 degrees. Both hands are open with the palms facing up and away. He bends his head back slightly and turns it to the right, so that the right side of his face is partly visible, looking up. His eyes are raised. He wears a long semi-transparent gown and has long curly hair falling over his shoulders. Beatrice likewise flies or hovers just above Dante and to the right, hiding him slightly. Her body is mostly horizontal, but she twists and bends at the waist so that her torso extends up to the right and faces away. Her lower body faces down and is extended to the left, with at least her right foot on tiptoe. She holds her slightly bent arms out horizontally to either side, with her hands open and the palms facing down. Her head is tilted back to look up, and turned so that her face is visible in profile. Her long curly hair floats around her shoulders. She wears a transparent gown.

component.illusobjdesc: The hovering figures of St. Peter, St. James, Beatrice, and Dante fill much of this design, which represents a vision of Dante's in Paradise. Wash around the figures suggests the sky.

Two flying or hovering figures enclosed in large flames fill much of the top half of this design. The figure on the left represents St. Peter. His body is largely horizontal, but he bends backwards slightly at the waist and lifts his head to look forward and right. His eyes are raised and his mouth is open slightly. He extends his bent right arm horizontally to the right, holding up the first two fingers of his raised right hand as if he bestows a blessing or benediction. His right palm is vertical, facing right. His left hand is visible below his chest, open with the palm up and holding a large key against his torso. His lower body extends left and away; his right leg is bent up at the knee and the bottom of his right foot is visible. His similarly raised left foot appears below and to the right of the right foot. He has a long beard and long curly hair; he wears a long semi-transparent gown that swirls around his legs.

Two figures enclosed in large flames fill much of the top half of this design. The figure on the left represents St. Peter. The flame in which he appears extends up towards the upper left corner of the design. Spiky beams of light issue from the flame, which also emits a diffuse radiance. Small tongues of fire are visible between the beams, especially below and to the left of St. Peter.

Two flying or hovering figures enclosed in large flames fill much of the top half of this design. The figure on the right represents St. James. His body extends diagonally up towards the upper right corner of the design. His lower body faces forward, but he twists his upper body down very slightly. His legs are together and seem to be slightly bent; his right foot hides his left. His left arm is by his side, bent up with the hand positioned in front of his torso and perhaps resting on his beard. His right arm is bent upward and slightly raised. His right hand, extended towards St. Peter on the left, is open with the palm facing forward and up. St. James' head is tilted back slightly and he looks forward and to the left. His eyes are raised. He has long curly hair and a long beard. He wears a long semi-transparent gown.

Two figures enclosed in large flames fill much of the top half of this design. The figure on the right represents St. James. The flame in which he appears extends up towards the upper right corner of the design. Spiky beams of light issue from the flame, which also emits a diffuse radiance. Small tongues of fire may be visible between the beams, especially below St. James.

Two figures enclosed in large flames fill much of the top half of this design. Beneath the figures, Dante flies or hovers near the bottom edge of the design. His lower body faces down and slightly away, but he twists and bends backward and right at the waist so that his upper body faces away and is seen from behind. He extends his arms to either side; the right arm is raised horizontally, while the left is raised at 135 degrees. Both hands are open with the palms facing up and away. He bends his head back slightly and turns it to the right, so that the right side of his face is partly visible, looking up. His eyes are raised. He wears a long semi-transparent gown and has long curly hair falling over his shoulders. His left foot seems to be pointed into tiptoe.

Two figures enclosed in large flames fill much of the top half of this design. Beneath the figures, Dante flies or hovers near the bottom edge of the design. Beatrice likewise flies or hovers just above Dante and to the right, hiding him slightly. Her body is mostly horizontal, but she twists and bends at the waist so that her torso extends up to the right and faces away. Her lower body faces down and is extended to the left, with at least her right foot on tiptoe. She holds her slightly bent arms out horizontally to either side, with her hands open and the palms facing down. Her head is tilted back to look up, and turned so that her face is visible in profile. Her long curly hair floats around her shoulders. She wears a transparent gown.

desc.objtitle:
Saint Peter and Saint James with Dante and Beatrice and with Saint John Also Saint John Joins the Other Saints and Dante and Beatrice,
Object 99 (Butlin 812.96)

illustration.illusobjdesc: Three large, glowing spheres dominate the design, which represents a vision of Dante's in Paradise. A bright arc crosses the design above the two lowermost spheres. Eight stars appear on the arc, divided evenly to the left and to the right of the uppermost sphere. Wash fills the spaces around the spheres, suggesting a sky suffused with light. Four lightly sketched, indistinct figures stand on the arc, with two on either side of the uppermost sphere. The two figures on the left seem to stand facing forward and to the right, with heads lowered slightly. The two figures on the right seem to stand facing forward and to the left. The leftmost of these two figures may lower its head slightly, though this figure is the most indistinct of all. All four seem to wear long gowns. Other features are impossible to discern. The leftmost sphere encases St. Peter, who kneels hovering or flying facing right and slightly forward. His legs are bent backwards at the knee, so that his lower legs extend up to the left and away. He leans back slightly at the waist, twisting to the right slightly and tilting his head back so that his face is visible in profile looking up to the right. His right arm is by his side, bent up at the elbow; his open right hand is visible below his chin with the vertical palm facing away. His lower left arm is down and cradles a large key in front of his body. He grasps the key with the fingers of his left hand. He has long curly hair and a long beard, both of which suggest his age. He wears a long semi-transparent gown. The rightmost sphere encases St. James. He kneels hovering or flying facing left and slightly forward. His legs are bent together and tucked beneath his body. His left foot is just visible beneath his buttocks, and may be on tiptoe. His left arm is down by his side, bent up at the elbow. His raised left hand is open with the vertical palm facing away from the viewer. His raised right hand is visible to the left of his shoulders, with the vertical palm facing out towards the viewer. He tilts his head back and raises his eyes to look up. He has curly long hair and a full beard, both of which suggest his age. He wears a long semi-transparent gown. The uppermost sphere encases St. John, who seems younger in appearance than St. James or St. Peter below. St. John hovers upside down with his torso facing away and slightly left. His legs are together and bent backwards at the knee, so that the soles of both feet are visible facing out. He bends his head back sharply, so that his face is visible looking forward and slightly to the right. His eyes are lowered as though he looks at the figures below him. His right arm is raised past his head and bent to the right at the elbow, and he holds his open hand out to the right with the palm facing up. His left arm is also raised; it crosses beneath his right and is bent up with the palm of his open hand facing up. Thus, both arms are at last partly wrapped around his upper body. He wears a transparent gown that swirls around his legs. His long curly hair flies around his head. All three spheres encasing the saints are radiant with light, and also emit spiky beams of light from segments of their circumferences. Dante and Beatrice kneel beneath the uppermost sphere and between the second and third spheres below. Dante faces away. His left leg is bent forward but bent beneath his body at the knee, and his left foot rests on tiptoe with the sole facing partly out. The sole of his right foot is just visible beneath his buttocks, and his position suggests that his right leg is drawn forward and up. Both of his arms are down by side but bent up and out at the elbows. His raised hands are open with the fingers spread and vertical palms facing away from his body. His left elbow may rest on his left thigh. He bends his head back sharply. His face is visible in profile looking up at St. John above. His long curly hair spills down between his shoulder blades. He wears a long semi-transparent gown. Dante hides Beatrice slightly. Beatrice's head is visible above and to the right of his, looking forward and to the right. She may tilt her head back slightly. Her eyes are raised to look up at St. John above. Her long curly hair floats around her head, while a sliver of light above her hair suggests a halo. Both of her hands are raised with the vertical palms facing out towards the viewer. Her right hand and lower right arm are visible to the left of Dante's left shoulder, while her left hand and arm appear above and to the right of Dante's right shoulder. Part of her lower body, clad in a long gown, may be visible to the right of Dante's right hip. A segment of the collar of this garment is visible above Dante's right shoulder.

component.illusobjdesc: Three large, glowing spheres, each enclosing the figure of a saint, dominate the design. A bright arc crosses the design above the two lowermost spheres. The uppermost sphere hides part of this arc.

Three large, glowing spheres dominate the design. A bright arc crosses the design above the two lowermost spheres. The uppermost sphere hides part of this arc. Eight stars appear on the arc, divided evenly to the left and to the right of the uppermost sphere.
Three large, glowing spheres dominate the design, which represents a vision of Dante's in Paradise. Wash fills the spaces around the spheres, suggesting a sky suffused with light.

Three large, glowing spheres dominate the design. A bright arc crosses the design above the two lowermost spheres; the third, uppermost sphere hides a segment of this arc. Four lightly sketched, indistinct figures stand on the arc, with two on either side of the uppermost sphere. The two figures on the left seem to stand facing forward and to the right, with heads lowered slightly. They seem to wear long gowns. Other features are impossible to discern.

Three large, glowing spheres dominate the design. A bright arc crosses the design above the two lowermost spheres; the third, uppermost sphere hides a segment of this arc. Four lightly sketched, indistinct figures stand on the arc, with two on either side of the uppermost sphere. The two figures on the right seem to stand facing forward and to the left. The leftmost of these two figures may lower its head slightly, though this figure is the most indistinct of all. Both seem to wear long gowns. Other features are impossible to discern.

Three large, glowing spheres dominate the design. The leftmost sphere encases St. Peter, who kneels hovering or flying facing right and slightly forward. His legs are bent backwards at the knee, so that his lower legs extend up to the left and away. His feet are pointed into tiptoes. He leans back slightly at the waist, twisting to the right slightly and tilting his head back so that his face is visible in profile looking up to the right. His right arm is by his side, bent up at the elbow; his open right hand is visible below his chin with the vertical palm facing away. This hand may rest on his beard. His lower left arm is down and cradles a large key in front of his body. He grasps the key with the fingers of his left hand. He has long curly hair and a long beard, both of which suggest his age. He wears a long semi-transparent gown. His mouth may be slightly open.
Three large, glowing spheres dominate the design. The leftmost sphere encases the figure of St. Peter. Radiant with light, it also emits spiky beams of light from its circumference on the left.

Three large, glowing spheres dominate the design. The rightmost sphere encases St. James. He kneels hovering or flying facing left and slightly forward. His legs are bent together and tucked beneath his body. His left foot is just visible beneath his buttocks, and may be on tiptoe. His left arm is down by his side, bent up at the elbow. His raised left hand is open with the vertical palm facing away from the viewer. His raised right hand is visible to the left of his shoulders, with the vertical palm facing out towards the viewer. He tilts his head back and raises his eyes to look up. His mouth is slightly open, displaying his teeth. He has curly long hair and a full beard, both of which suggest his age. He wears a long semi-transparent gown.
Three large, glowing spheres dominate the design. The rightmost sphere encases the figure of St. James. Radiant with light, it also emits spiky beams of light from its circumference on the right.

Three large, glowing spheres dominate the design. The uppermost sphere encases St. John, who seems younger in appearance than St. James or St. Peter below. St. John hovers upside down with his torso facing away and slightly left. His legs are together and bent backwards at the knee, so that the soles of both feet are visible facing out. He bends his head back sharply, so that his face is visible looking forward and slightly to the right. His eyes are lowered as though he looks at the figures below him. His mouth is open slightly. His right arm is raised past his head and bent to the right at the elbow, and he holds his open hand out to the right with the palm facing up. His left arm is also raised; it crosses beneath his right and is bent up with the palm of his open hand facing up. Thus, both arms are at least partly wrapped around his upper body. He wears a transparent gown that swirls around his legs. His long curly hair flies around his head.

Three large, glowing spheres dominate the design. The uppermost sphere encases the figure of St. John. Radiant with light, it also emits spiky beams of light from its edges to right and left. A small dark shadow appears just beyond its circumference in the upper left.

Three large, glowing spheres, each encasing the figure of a saint, dominate the design. Dante and Beatrice kneel beneath the uppermost sphere and between the second and third spheres below. Dante faces away. His left leg is bent forward but bent beneath his body at the knee, and his left foot rests on tiptoe with the sole facing partly out. The sole of his right foot is just visible beneath his buttocks, and his position suggests that his right leg is drawn forward and up. Both of his arms are down by his side but bent up and out at the elbows. His raised hands are open with the fingers spread and vertical palms facing away from his body. His left elbow may rest on his left thigh. He bends his head back sharply. His face is visible in profile looking up at St. John above. His long curly hair spills down between his shoulder blades. He wears a long semi-transparent gown.

Three large, glowing spheres, each encasing the figure of a saint, dominate the design. Dante and Beatrice kneel beneath the uppermost sphere and between the second and third spheres below. Dante faces away and hides Beatrice slightly. Her head is visible above and to the right of his, looking forward and to the right. She may tilt her head back slightly. Her eyes are raised to look up at St. John above. Her long curly hair floats around her head, while a sliver of light above her hair suggests a halo. Both of her hands are raised with the vertical palms facing out towards the viewer. Her right hand and lower right arm, bent up, are visible to the left of Dante's left shoulder. Her left shoulder, left hand, and raised lower left arm appear above and to the right of Dante's right shoulder. Part of her lower body, clad in a long gown, may be visible to the right of Dante's right hip. A segment of the collar of this garment is visible above Dante's right shoulder.

lg.l:
Paradiso Canto 25
This inscription is extremely faint and has been painted over in wash. Our reading of the second word and the number is conjectural.

desc.objtitle:
The Vision of the Deity from Whom Proceed the Nine Spheres The Divine Essence from Whom Derive the Nine Spheres,
Object 100 (Butlin 812.97)

illustration.illusobjdesc: This design depicts Dante's Paradisal vision of the divine order, which extends from God at the top of the design through the ranks of angels to the earth at the bottom. Although the Paradiso describes Dante's vision as being of concentric rings, Blake has drawn the rings as curved layers or arcs that cross the design horizontally. A heavenly body is associated with each arc, and its representation appears at the center of that arc. A pair of figures, or paired groupings of figures, also appear on each arc. Clouds surround these figures. Wash throughout the design suggests the sky. Flat ground covered with grass runs across the bottom of the design and represents the earth, the material world. A low hill or knoll, also covered with grass, rises in the center of this flat ground. The lowest arc is associated with the angels and the moon, which appears as a small sphere at the center of this arc. Blake depicts the head and shoulders of two of these angels, one at either end of the arc. Both are male with long curly hair and folded, raised wings. The arc second to lowest is associated with Mercury and the archangels. Mercury is depicted as a small sphere, surrounded by a cloud, at the center of this arc. Blake depicts the head and shoulders of two archangels, one at each end of the arc. Both are male and turn their heads inward towards Mercury. A halo surmounts each archangel's curly hair. Each has one set of large wings bent up behind his back, and a second set of wings drawn up inside the first and visible above his head. The arc third from lowest is associated with Venus and the Principalities, which appear here as a pair of youthful female angels. Venus is depicted as a sphere, surrounded by a cloud, at the center of the arc. The Principalities on this arc turn their heads to look forward and away from Venus. They have long curly hair and large wings that may fold partly around their bodies. The arc fourth from the bottom is associated with the Powers, here shown as a pair of middle-aged female angels, and the sun. The sun is depicted as a glowing sphere emitting beams of light at the center of this arc. The Powers, with long curly hair floating around their heads, look up and away from the sun. They have large wings drawn up on either side of their heads. The arc fifth from the bottom is associated with the Virtues, which appear here as the heads of male soldiers, and with Mars. Blake depicts Mars as a circle or sphere marked with a cross and surrounded with a cloud. The soldiers wear helmets and look forward with wings folded. The arc sixth from the bottom is associated with the Dominions, which appear here as bearded men, and with Jupiter. Blake depicts Jupiter as a sphere surrounded by a cloud at the center of the arc. Both bearded, long-haired Dominions are visible from the shoulders up; they look forward with wings folded on either side. The arc third from the top is associated with the Thrones, which appear here as a pair of bearded old men, and with Saturn. Blake depicts Saturn as a sphere surrounded by a cloud at the center of this arc. The Thrones tilt their heads forward and turn them inward towards Saturn. They have beards and long hair, as well as large wings.
